text:
Amazing Italian food! I just love the sauce and homemade pasta!!!
I just had them cater for a family party and everyone said it was incredible!!
Everything we ordered was perfect! Favorites of mine are the Greek Salad, Bolognese pasta, sausage and peppers, and meatball subs!

Love Plantone's the only reason  for three stars is We haven't worked our way through the whole menu yet. Coming from the east coast (new haven, conn & New York area trust me We know good Italian food) I agree the chicken parm needs more sauce. I am sure they will adjust. After all that is what Yelp is for. Every new restaurant needs a break in period. The staff is always friendly and helpfull.  There isn't a kids menu posted but just ask they will hook you up.
 The best yet is the  Roast Pork Italian. If we eat in or to go no matter what, we get we always get a whole one of these with spinach to go. I will repost as the stars raise above the 5 mark.
mangia salvatore mangia.
 Ok we had friends over and we had a tasting. Everything was great. Updated to 5 Stars Thanks Plantones

Tried this place for lunch & was I pleasantly surprised! The pasta was excellent as well as the Italian sandwich!!! Took my granddaughter & she ate all her meal!  The service was excellent & everyone was so helpful & cheerful!! Will go back with family for dinner!! Will have to try pizza there next.

The owner Glenn was great! He provided us with outstanding service and good recommendations for food. The calzone, Italian sausage, and pasta trifecta were tasty! A great place to visit with friendly staff!

I know everyone has a different palate when it comes to pizza but I've got to give Plantone's a big thumbs up! I love this pizza!! We tried the Quattro Formaggio and the Tony Pepperoni and both were great! The sauce is flavorful and perfectly seasoned, using San Marzano tomatoes (the only way to go).  The pepperoni is incredible - large pieces and grilled before being baked on the pizza. A unique selection of cheeses on the Quattro, both interesting and delicious! My only recommendation is they bake the pizza just a little bit longer - the dough is chewy and I like mine a little more crusty.

We went back a few weeks later and tried the Angry Sicilian and meatball sub sandwiches. Both come highly recommended by my son and husband. The tiramisu is definitely worth it!

While not having dined in yet, they have a selection of wines and beer and happy hour all day on Sunday.

This place is down the street and decided to give it a try. The reviews were also a factor in trying this place and they did not disappoint. We were greeted when we got to the counter. Their menu isn't too busy but there is a good amount to choose from. I decided on a slice of pepperoni pizza, I didn't know it would be so big, and chicken parm pasta. Both were really good, the sauce wasn't like what I've had before, it wasn't super runny. The flavor was good and somewhat chunky tomato sauce. You get a good amount of food for what you pay for.

Curbside Service is NOT as Advertised

Being 8 months pregnant and running errands all day, I was ecstatic when I found out that Plantone's had curbside service. I called in my order ahead of time and the employee who took my order told me to give them a call when I park in the designated curbside parking spots. Upon arriving, I call the same number, and another employee tells me that I have to come in to the restaurant and pay. I was confused because typically an employee comes out to give you your food and obtain payment, thus curbside service. So I ask the employee to clarify as I thought they had curbside service. The employee tells me that typically you have to go in and pay and can choose to sit in your car in the designated spots until the food is complete and they'll bring it out. What's the point of curbside pick up if I have to go in and pay anyways?!?! I might as well just pick up my food when I pay for it, which is what I ended up doing. I voiced my concern when I went in to pay and the two employees at the check out counter were apathetic and didn't have any response for me. This has been my 2nd experience of poor service here.
Being in the restaurant industry for over 20 years, service is a factor for me and I won't be back.

This is the second time that I ordered from there. I'm on the fence about how much the subs cost and how big they are. The actual size of a small meatball sub seems kinda small for the price. The food is fresh and good, but the size of the small subs are lacking.

Went back today 12 months later food was much better but the entire place full of someone trying to sell some kinda pyramid scheme..  The place was crowded and a sound system was setup too loud.. Should have closed to regular customers when hosting 30+

I only eat Italian food, this is no Italian, the amount of cheese that they need to plaster on this pizza is hilarious. There's more flavor in a chuckle cheese pizza sauce. Garlic bread is soggy. Pasta is days old or from box or both. Pathetic execution and recipes  for an Italian market

Ate here today for lunch today finally. I found this place while delivering food that I picked up here. I had the angry Sicilian sandwich and it was amazing. I've found a few good Italian sandwiches in town but this one was great, by far the best. I arrived just as they were opening and was greeted by the owner who invited me right in and it smells amazing inside. The owner is a very personable guy and spoke with every customer that came in and it was apparent he really cared about customer satisfaction (no need to worry though the product could sell it self). Owner is from New York and stays true to that by making authentic Italian food complete with fresh in house made mozzarella. I would definitely recommend this place and I will definitely be back to try the pizza. (If you get a sandwich try the spicy mustard it's delicious)

Great VIBE here!! I had the Goodfella Club which was delicious!! We also tried their Antipasto Board that had fresh mozzarella and paired it with one of their white wines, it was AWESOME! Everything tasted very good and fresh, definitely coming back to try one of their hot subs next! 

The staff was super friendly and very attentive to the many questions I had about the menu. Great spot overall!!
It's rather fabulous! A slice of New York City. Plenty of varity to choose from!! I personally enjoy the many choices of pizza, and the staff and management are very helpful.

It was our first time here at Pantone's and the food was excellent.  I highly suggest the lobster ravioli with the vodka sauce. Hannah The cashier was very informative and she really helped us out with our cannoli. It was good to see the manager working the line he thinks highly of his business and it makes him a real leader.

Fantastic place to eat!  The pizza was awesome. Perfect amount of sauce!

The sitting area was clean, the music playing was nice.   The place looked absolutely clean.   And the smell was heaven

I heard about their grand opening event on yelp. The idea of free pizza ever week for a year was tempting but at the price of waiting all night in the cold .... Definitely needed a taste test before that level of commitment!

We ordered Mama's meat lasagna and  pizza verdure la rosti. 

The lasagna was a pretty big portion, however it was just okay. The sauce wasn't "I'll probably be dreaming about this later" good but it filled us up.

I wanted to try the pizza verdure la rosti because there was eggplant in it. The pizza was full of other vegetables like squash, zuchini and tomatoes. This combo made the pizza thick and juicy. It was definitely different experience compared to a supreme pizza.

The ambiance of the place was warm and inviting. Loved the decor and the music selection. They're outside dinning section looks nice but we decided to stay nice and cozy inside.

I ordered the build your own individual pizza, and I must say this is one of the best pizzas I've ever had!! It was a little pricey, $15.00 for a 10" individual pizza with a fountain drink, but very worth it!!.

The food is good. No question about it, but the pricing is all over the board. Pizza/calzones are underpriced and pasta is super overpriced. Example:  $11 for 1 cup of pasta with 3 small slices of not toasted bread. No prices on the menu for drinks. Small fountain drink is around $2.50; a tad high.  Meatball sub was amazing. This place is not on the level of Cugino's on Maryland, but could get there with some slight changes.  Thank god they didn't call the place "Tony Boloney's".
Such a great experience! Customer service was great and the food was delicious! Will definitely come here again when I'm in town. The owner came around to greet everyone!
Great pizza, great meat balls, great owners.  My meat balls were a little cold, and I like a little more tomato flavor in my pizza sauxe, but all in all, great!

Just finished up a roast pork and broccoli rabe sandwich. It was fantastic. It was my first time here and this is the only thing I had so far. The staff is really cool I walked in at closing time not knowing it was closing time and they still accommodated me. Great ambience and great music too.

Sat on the patio really nice to enjoy some wine, antipasto board and pizza!!!!!  Delicious! I did notice  there was Labatts and Molson Canadian Beer available and I asked where the owners were from and they are from upstate New York! Me too!!! My husband and I will be definitely back!!!!

We tried this place out for my sons Birthday & it was amazing! We tried the pizza, meatball hot sub, roast pork Italian sub & angry Sicilian. We loved it all it was soooo delicious. This will be our new go to place. Service was great and the staff was very welcoming. I highly recommend it!

My sister saw an ad on Facebook so we decided to try it. They were very nice and friendly from the time we got there right to the time we left. I had the cheesesteak and it was very good. My sister had the chicken salad sandwich and she loved it. We got the Angry Sicilian for her husband (he is an Italian so his thoughts are very important when it comes to Italian food). He said the sub was very good. And he wants to go there too next time. We got the homemade cheesecake, homemade tiramisu, and the cannoli. They were each beyond yummy but we were to full from dinner to finish them. I'm thinking midnight snack.  We will definitely be back!!
Great restaurant! Me and my wife had our babies gender reveal here with about 30 friends and family. Everyone loved the food. The owner and staff is very friendly.
Amazing!!! Angry Sicilian a must try!!!! Pizza is amazing and if your lucky enough to get a cannoli before they run out they are amazing as well!

I came back & ordered chicken piccata. They improved the serving size, I really enjoyed my meal it was freshly made & taste good. 

Old review:
I ordered chicken piccata with pasta & garlic bread. The portion was so small. I've had much better chicken piccata.

I have been a few times now and I will say the food has always been very good. This visit however they were out of my first two options, the chicken salad and tuna salad. This is not the end of the world but for some reason it drives me crazy when restaurants are out of one item, much less two. Then when we finally got it they served it to us in to go bags when we were dining in. Again, food has always been very good but this last visit had a couple annoying  instances that ruffled my feathers.

The pizza was amazing!! The thin crust was just the prefect amount of crispy and chewy. The San Marzano tomato sauce was sweet and light and the house made mozzarella was really great. My boyfriend never likes cheese on his pizza and he even loved it. I asked them to make the pizzas a little extra crispy and they came out great. The large build your own was 17.50 for three meats and unlimited veggie toppings and it was terrific. We also got the Mama's Margarita which was 15.50 and was fantastic! It's not cheap but you could most definitely taste the quality ingredients that were used. The sausage, cheese, and sauce were a step above the rest! I'll be back soon!

The food was delicious, everything there is made out of scratch.  We had the chicken Parmesan sandwich , four cheese pizza and one of the best tiramissu we ever had. The prices are pretty reasonable also , atmosphere is great , reminds me of one of those little Italian cafes from Rome :)

5 stars is simply not enough for this restaurant! Everything on the menu is authentic and delicious! You walk in and immediately you feel at home. Everything is made in house daily and it shows in all the dishes! So happy to finally find a place like this in Vegas!

OMG! I feel it's tough to get EXCITED about a deli, but I am excited about this place. I walked in on a Thursday at lunch time - the place smelled amazing - the staff was attentive and in a great mood - the place was clean - the decor was inviting - and the sandwiches were delicious. I will definitively be back!

Not sure if it was an off night but first experiment wasn't great. We ordered to go and waited a LONG time for our pizza and fettuccine. I finally asked if a box on counter was mine. It was. Was already cold and when I took it home and put it in the oven it didn't improve. All soggy and not good. Didn't even eat it :-(  
Will probably try again as I feel it was an off night.  The place is very cute inside and the girl -Melody- who is the "greeter" was adorable.

This is an adorable restaurant/deli, very quaint and inviting. The owner and his son both display a passion for their venture, and are so friendly and inviting. All the staff is terrific and offer great customer service. The place screams, "Italy". And the food...have I mentioned the food? Oh my gosh! This is my new favorite place, with my new favorite Italian foods. I can never finish my meal as the portions are large, so I always have a ready-made lunch for the next day. The sauces are yummy and the salads are so fresh! Having traveled to many places in Italy I must say, this is the real deal!!!  You must try it!
My favorite Italian/subs place! Everyone's super friendly, the food is delicious and fresh!! The place is great! I love the warm and cold subs! And they're a good size. Always leave satisfied.

Great place to stop by for a quick bite. Pizza is Neapolitan style....thin middle, thicker edge with a nice chew. Sandwiches looked very large & tasty. The staff was super friendly and very informative. They explained just about anything you wanted to know. Tvs & tables inside and a nice little fire pit lounge area outside along with table seating. Not quite sure why they call it an Italian market though. Very slim pickings for that.
This place is unreal. Food is so good, service is awesome, location is perfect. Love it. Can't recommend it enough!!

The supervisor with the first name starting with a M with currently blonde hair is the most unfriendly customers service person I have ever meet
If customer service is not your passion 
Than working in a fast food restaurant is not for you 
Don't know her full name because she hides her name 
Still staff is unknowledgeable still gets orders messed up 
Never once in 8 weeks has an order been right
Quality of food is ok
Do not order the chicken parm sandwich 
It's all bread and at $12 a true disappointment 
Never again 
I will not pay with my hard earned money to someone that is rude ad give them a paycheck
My boyfriend ordered that angry Sicilian and I ordered the chicken parm hero. Both were really good with large portions. Definitely will be coming back here.

I had high hopes for this place since it was soooo close to home and because of how much I love Italian food. 

Experience #1: got off work ordered a sub and asked for no onions and no tomatoes, and spaghetti with meat sauce. 
I got home and realized they didn't get my sandwich right and my pasta was pretty bland. I called and told them about my sandwich being wrong and they told me they would have make me a new one or I could get a credit for another sandwich on my next visit. I figured they were pretty busy and I wouldn't sweat it. Plus I just got a free sammich! Score!!! Thanks and well played management!  

Experience #2: went in for my free sandwich and NO DICE! They weren't having it so I left. 

Experience #3 (5/1017) : it had been a couple months and my mom was interested so I took her. We ordered, took our number and sat. They brought the food and they messed mine up again. They took note of their mishap and sent the Events Coordinator out to speak with me. 

She (Kristin) comes out wearing the same thing everyone else in the kitchen is, doesn't introduce herself and sits down in my moms chair (She went to the restroom) and begins talking like we're friends. My first question was "who are you?" And you're in my moms chair. She apologizes at first then says, we don't want you to tell 5 friends about your experience and they tell their friends... blah blah blah.... 
My mom chimes in with a "I could understand if you guys were packed but you're not even busy" (like 2 other tables and us). 
They bring my food out again and it's just not good at all. So Kristin comes out again and begins asking me how was it and I was honest. Chicken isn't grilled, sauce doesn't have much flavor other than salt salt and more salt and the sracha sauce was like a mix of sracha and ketchup.  She got offended and told me "well, I can make you like our food!"  At this point I was like any one in the food industry knows customer service and this was not it. Especially when there are only 2 other tables. Cmon!  She could've offered a different meal or the sandwich I never got. 

Either way this place sucked before sucks now. Who knows about the future. Gave this place 2 chances with three separate experiences. Fail fail fail. If you don't know what "flavor" is then you'll be satisfied. If you want flavor then go to Roma Deli 2 (w Sahara/Durango) they don't skimp on the sauce and they speak Italian. 

#JustSayin #NoFlava #AwfulCustomerService #KristinShoukdLearnCommonCourtesyAndManners
We had a great experience here. The pizza was fantastic and the service was top-notch. We will be back frequently.

I went last week to Plantone's after reading about it in the RJ. 
I have only tried the pizza. It was the best I have had in the 20 plus years I have lived here. 
Cannot wait to return to try more food. 
The service was great. The staff was welcoming.  

The only con is the parking lot. This is no fault of the business. 
The park lot is small and always full.

I was recently told about this place by my best friend and I was happy to hear that finally, a place like Cugino's Italian Deli & Pizza by UNLV is now on the southwest side of town. There has not been many good "family-owned" style places in town or many at all. Besides Cugino's by UNLV as previously mentioned, Nora's on Flamingo between Jones and Decatur, and Roma Deli on Spring Mountain between Jones and Decatur, I don't think there are many others like them. 

Came here for a small "in-between meal" eats after the gym the other day (ssssh don't judge). Conveniently located on Warm Springs, just west of Durango, in the same shopping center as SkinnyFats, it now resides in the previously known Mac Shack location. Décor is pretty nice with TVs mounted on the wall. A "wall" rack with ingredients (similar to Cuginos and Roma Deli) most likely used in their own food as well dividing the restaurant from the line to order and the seating area. Decent amount of seating including seating outside. Also some bar seats for those who come here alone and don't wanna take up an entire table yourself. 

Offerings are a bit different than previously mentioned places but has pieces of what the others are popular for as well. They do fresh made pizzas with some specialties as well as building your own. Also cold and hot sandwiches (or build your own as well) and chef's daily specials. Boar's head branded deli meats is no newbie to the Las Vegas market and this place doesn't fail to do so as well. 

Always being one to pick the one with the most stuff, I easily picked the "Angry Sicilian" sandwich. The sandwich consists of prosciutto, capicola, soppressata, mortadella, house-made mozzarella topped with roasted red peppers, lettuce, tomatoes, onions and drizzled with some extra virgin olive oil, red wine vinegar, and a sprinkle of oregano.... all on your choice of either sesame load, multi-gran loaf, italian loaf, pizza bianca (flatbread), or rye bread. For a small size, it was $9, large $14.95. And of course, I went for the large. (NO I did not eat it all. remember I said small "in-between meal" ? I only ate half, saved half for another day. Ive always been a fan of Italian meats over the traditional deli meats (ham, turkey, roast beef, etc) as it brings so much more depth and flavor. Mozzarella is also one of my favorite cheeses ! Light, smooth thick slices of a mild cheese made traditionally with water buffalo milk... Mmm :) Wonder if they sell mozzarella by itself ? Om nom nom hahaha. Overall, super flavorful sandwich which brings memories of my frequent visits to Cugino's when I went to UNLV. a MUST GET if you cant decide on what to get ! 

Cant wait to come here again and try other things ! UNFORTUNATELY ! (boohoo... xD) its so close to EOS gym... HEHE :) and sonics... happy hour half drinks (strawberry limeade...) and suzuya for dessert... LOL XD sssh im a piggy ... 

Ate the leftover sandwich the next day. Still pretty good. As it was already a "cold" sandwich, pulling it out of the fridge maybe 15 minutes before eating it made it as good as it was freshly made

I was extremely excited to be able to support a small business in my area and have given the business several opportunities to make up for their issues which I initially thought was because it was new but it's going on 3 months since opening and things have only gone downhill in terms of quality and consistency. Don't let the name fool you, this is no italian market. I would be surprised if they even have a slicer on the premises as you cannot buy cured meats or any italian cheeses on site aside from prepackaged items and dry pasta that I'm pretty sure has been there since its grand opening.

Decor is nice. Outdoor seating features fire pits and the interior is a mix of rustic wood and brick. Their brick oven looks impressive--custom designed down to the name of the business--Tony Bolony--but wait, isn't their business called Plantones? A quick google shows Tony Baloneys is a trademarked named business in San Francisco. Perhaps an oversight on their part and a very pricey one.

It's unfortunately another one of those restaurants that makes the mistake of opting to provide both fast food service (go to the counter to order, fill your own drinks etc) with server service. If they wanted to provide a full service dining experience they should just offer it when you walk in. And since you aren't assigned any server in particular food runners get confused since they didn't take your order and don't know where to go or who to look for or who to give the food. More often than not I will get my food before the customers who arrived before me for whatever reason. I guess I'm just lucky? Cashiers are hit and miss--some are just there obviously for the paycheck. No smile no greeting. Just jaded looking teenagers waiting to clock out. Servers have always provided service with a smile--more recently they have been exceptional, the only reason they should get any stars at all.

The actual pizzas are virtually flavorless. The bottoms of pizzas show their lack of cleaning of their oven. Covered in black soot. Perhaps they thought this would add to the flavor of the pizza? It's hard to tell that they were baked in a brick oven pizza as it lacks any flavor hinting towards that. The pepperoni itself is sparse and extremely mild. The grilled chicken also has no seasoning whatsoever and the texture of their mushrooms is miserable--like they boiled or microwaved them and just threw them into storage. Another pizza place which shall remain unnamed has $8 12" pizzas with unlimited toppings with over 30 to choose from... Plantones (10" for $10) just can't compare with less than 20 toppings.

Sandwiches are extremely small for the price and NOTHING like the owner posted photos! The meat is sparse and also lack flavor. The chicken parm is a soggy mess and maybe 4 inches long! The italian sausage barely has any seasoning and lacks any spice whatsoever... The meat in the baloney sandwich was completely blackened--no joke! I guess this is what happens when a realtor tries to be a restaurateur. If he wants his business to succeed the restaurant would be better off without him there as he completely lacks customer service skills and seems to have a poor attitude when he is there.

I tried this place for the first time today and was definitely impressed. I am extremely picky about chicken parmigiana and this sandwich was terrific. It wasn't mostly over cooked breading like a lot of places...it was a nice thick chicken cutlet with just the right amount of breading cooked just right so it wasn't overly crunchy or soggy. The Angry Sicilian was built just right with quality Italian deli meats and fresh mozzarella and the perfect amount of mayo oil and vinegar. I've lived within walking distance of this place for a year now and kept passing it by...I will be adding this to my regular foodie rotation now.

Plantone's is good- but I would recommend for lunch or a casual night dinner spot. We live across the street and decided to try it out. Apparently it was the grand opening night so there was a DJ and lots of Italian balloons so we went on a good night. I was hoping that it was a sit-down Italian spot because it was a Friday night and I wanted to relax after a long week. However, Plantone's is more of a quick-order deli where you place your order at the counter, take a number and grab a seat. We had to sit at a bar top because it was so busy- good sign of what was to come, but like I said-I wanted a more relaxing atmosphere!

Another pet peeve is that the wine is served in plain glasses. I know that serving wine in water glasses is the authentic Italian way, but when I spend $8 on a glass on wine- I prefer it to be in a nicer glass. We ordered the eggplant parm sandwich and a Quattro formaggio pizza. Both were tasty- especially the pizza. Thin crust and fresh out of the oven. I could tell that the pizza was made with the freshest ingredients. I also enjoyed the sandwich, but my only suggestion would be to toast the bread-it needed a little crunch.

Overall this place is A-Ok for lunch or if I am looking for a casual week night for some quick and yummy food. Looked like they had a nice outdoor area that I can see myself enjoying during the summer months. 

We met the manager/owner and he was great. I hope this place does well!

Italian Market......where? It's a casual walk up stare at order board, place oder, pay, get a number, they deliver food. The fresh pasta menu is on one side of the line and no pasta menu where you order. Bad placement -solution...have 2 fresh pasta menus. 

Food was delicious. Seemed priced correctly for quality and amount. Coke cola fountain drinks .

Seating is various kinds. High bench and high bar stools ,  armless chairs and table, and outside searing with bench and chairs with arms.

Great family run Italian Deli. Despite the name, it's not a "Market" where you're going to find an assortment of Italian goodies. There are a few items on display that from a marketing perspective certainly play to the name, but, it's an Italian Deli / Pizza / Pasta place. You order at the counter and they bring your food out to you.

Unfortunately, unless I missed it in the store, both the online and in store menus give little indication of the Chicken, Fettuccine, Ravioli, Penne and Spaghetti, with the typical sauces, that are also available.

Based on 2 visits I've found the service friendly and attentive. 

From the Deli the Meatball Sub was solid and the Roast Pork Sub was really good!!! The Pasta Fagoli was good as well.

The Pizza is excellent!!! It's very close to an authentic Neapolitan crust, thin in the middle and a wonderful, thick, chewy crust on the edges.

From the Pasta side we had Ravioli with marinara. The Pasta was good and I loved the marinara sauce!!!

We'll certainly be back.
EVERYTHING HERE IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! Huge pizza and pasta persona and it just blew me away! Definitely will be back

Plantone's is the newest business to hit the south west side- small market, pizza bar, and a massive selection of sandwiches. From the minute you walk in, service is on point! There's a greeter stationed at the entrance to walk you through the menu and make suggestions, along with multiple staff attending to the dining room and checking on customers.

Pizza is available whole or by the slice- and slices are huge! The Paulie's Pesto Chicken was a great choice, with a thin stretched crust and a robust sauce. The Quattro Formaggio was even better for this cheese lover.  Tried the Italian Pork sandwich with broccolini and sharp provolone, and it was hearty and flavorful. Heads up that the au jus makes it a poor choice for takeout, so come try it when you can stick around.

Prices are pretty reasonable for the product and portion. There is patio seating that looks like it'll nearly double their available seating space in warmer months. This was already a busy plaza before they opened, so I imagine parking is only going to get more hectic. Coming back for the Angry Sicilian soon!

EDIT 03/23/2018: A year in, and they're still solid. The Angry Sicilian sando is huge and fresh, while my new fave pizza is their brunch option with scrambled eggs, pepperoni, cheese, and arugula. They also offer desserts, from cheesecake to cannoli, and their covered patio is perfect for spring!

Been there twice.  First time the pizza was under cooked and raw in ghetto middle. Second time we I ordered I specifically asked them to make sure it was cooked thru. The pizza I received was burnt on the top and still raw in the middle.  The first time we were able to finish it off in the oven at home but the second time it was an inedible mess..  we were given an attitude when we brought it back. There are better pizza places in the area.
Finally tried this place and it did not disappoint. I had their pepperoni pizza and my husband had a cold sub, both so delicious! Looking forward to going back.

GUYS.  They make their own mozzarella.  What more do you need?  Because there is PLENTY more to be excited about but I'm going to keep talking about the fresh mozzarella.  It's so ridiculously good that my go-to is the caprese sandwich and I don't even like tomatoes but I will eat them with this mozzarella and their amazing pesto.  

Get the lobster ravioli if you can tear yourself away from the fresh mozzarella.  Hell, get both.  

Service is excellent.  Everybody is super attentive, they fix their rarely-made mistakes quickly and with aplomb.  Soundtrack is Rat Pack essentials, and I dig that.

I chose to try this place rather than my original Skinny Fats destination.  I'm so glad I did!  The Angry Sicilian is the best sandwich I've had in awhile.  The ingredients all tasted fresh.  They didn't have much in place as far as pasta dishes go, but this clearly isn't a pasta shop.  I'll be making this my go-to sandwich shop.

This is a cute place, we sat on the patio it was a nice day. We fisrt started with the antipasto board omg if i could of have a second order i would of have but i still needed room for my main dish. Me and my son shared the cicken parm yumm yumm it was delicious and for dessert had yhe nutella pizza wow what and end to this delicious meal. We will definitely be back when in vegas.
Love this spot. Perfect addition to the neighborhood. The deli sandwiches are great and the pizza's even better. The Tony Bologna is my favorite with space mustard. I'll be stopping by often.

Excellent! I had seen them on Yelp & had to go in for the Angry Sicilian Sandwich. It was just as the picture showed & described. The meat, highest quality & fresh. Their house made Mozzarella was creamy & delicious. Another customer had the Italian Hot Dog. 2 long dogs in a boat of bread with condiments. Looked yummy. He said its always what he goes in for. For house made quality their prices are very reasonable. More affordable than restaurants that serve processed food. I will be back. How anyone can give them less than 5 Stars is beyond me. If at anytime, anywhere there's a problem with an order give the server a chance to rectify concerns. Love this very nice clean family owned restaurant. Best sandwich I've ever had & I'm 67. Bravo! I just ordered a build your own pizza. I requested sliced onion instead of chopped & fresh basil instead of basil pesto with meats. Came fast & exactly as requested. The wood fired pizza crust is excellent! Their sauce is excellent. This restaurant is a gem with fresh ingredients. I live alone so will have enough pizza for the Knights game tomorrow. Go Knights! I'm thrilled to find Italian that is fresh & tasty. Not easy in this day & time. Thank You Plantones! I'll be back for other dishes & having had the sauce I can only imagine how it enhances other dishes. Jan

Come for the pizza!  Stay because you're too stuffed to move.

I met my lucky charm here for a girls lunch during the week.  She and I love to split an abundance of menu items to get a better tasting in one meal.  When I say abundance I mean we split Momma's Meat Lasagna, The Anitpasti Board, a slice of Paulie's Pesto Chicken and Tony's Pepperoni.  You wouldn't think it would be over doing it but their slice of pizza seems to be half of a pizza.  Yeah it's not your average slice.  

Starting with the antipasti board really gets the taste buds going and the stomach warmed up.  It's a lovely spread of meats, fresh cheese, artichokes and roasted red peppers.  The lasagna is perfectly named as the sauce and layers are filled with meat to create this pasta dish.  It wasn't my favorite but maybe because of the pizza.  I couldn't get enough bites of the Pesto Chicken.  The white sauced pizza combined with the pesto chicken is fantastic. The crust is what really stands out and what makes or breaks a pizza.  The pepperoni pizza did not disappoint either.  Again I think it's the delicious crust which made it stand out from many of the other pizza establishments around the area.  

With plenty to choose from on the regular menu, they also offer specials daily.   Enjoy their food in the dining area with plenty of seating.  On the lovely days, they have a beautiful patio seating area.  I'm definitely a fan of Plantone's!

First time here and the food/ingredients were tasty, 
Loved the cheesesteak and the mac n cheese was very good.

Update on second visit,  Visited on Sunday afternoon, different time and different crew. It was honestly so so this second time around.  The cook was simply careless and you could taste it in the bland food he put out? Big change from first visit.  I reached out but was ignored. 2stars won't be back.

This review is from my son - 
Nice seating area - no real market - didn't plan to eat but I saw macaroni & cheese pizza with bacon with French fries on top - nothing will be left.

Underlying pizza is from wood fired brick oven so good foundation for individual pizzas.

This place was fantastic!  The food was delicious and the atmosphere couldn't have been better!  Tony helped me personally to receive the dish that I ordered and Glenn (Owner) stopped by and we chatted at length about his vision coming to reality and how cool it will be to dine outside on the patio when it warms up a bit.  Authentic and High Quality Italian Cuisine - We loved it and will return soon!
Went for lunch, great selection, Angry Sicilian was delicious, meatballs and Italian sausage taste homemade. Definitely be back to try more.

They have great food! Great customer service! I love the Pesto Chicken Pizza and the Caesar Salad! My favorites. I'm excited to keep on trying new things, next time I come to eat at Plantone's. Definitely go give it a try!

Great food! The day after Christmas, no one in the family wanted to cook so we stopped in and ordered a bunch of things including pizza, a chicken parm sub, a hot dog sub, a meatball sub, antipasto salad with anchovies, and the antipasto board. It was fantastic, and I will probably stop ordering pizza elsewhere. This is really good Italian eats --- way better than Mac Shack (which used to occupy this building)!

Was invited for a work dinner and they catered to a larger group wonderfully. The restaurant had a long family style booth as well as smaller tables throughout. Got us started with some sandwiches filled with all the meat varieties and salad. 
I was able to try two different kinds of pizza: margarita & Italian sausage + broccoli rabe. 
The crust wasn't too thin and crispy :) 
Ingredients were fresh and not too greasy overall it was great.

My absolute favorite that was served: meatballs. Hands down. First of all, they're huge !! 
I literally wanted to devour them all, but had to share (and didn't have enough room) 
The service was great, constantly had servers topping off drinks and making sure everything was going great. 

Definitely would recommend this place! They know how to do Italian.
Best cheesestake I have ever tased. Customer service was great and  ambiance was perfect. Joked about coming back tomorrow... but i think we really are.

They made a terrible mistake on my food pizza was soggy salad was hard ass hell !!called for them to remake it they promised I drive all the way there the owner lied about remaking my order he even did a false phone call to the staff about my order fuckin liars!

I was so excited to try this place from all the photos I saw online, my mouth was drooling!  Unfortunately, I left there very disappointed. I ordered the Tommy's tomato pie, which essentially is a cheese pizza with basil on top. The pie barely had any cheese on it and way too much sauce. The dough wasn't cooked all the way, so the bottom wasn't golden brown, it was white, soggy and soft. When I got to the crust it was super salty I couldn't finish it. I also ordered a slice of the cheesecake which turned out very dry and bland. The staff there was super friendly and helpful, but it was also way overpriced for the quality and amount of food. For a personal size cheese pizza, a drink, and slice of cheesecake, my meal came out to almost $20! I'm not one for fast food pizza, but Dominos or Pizza Hut is better quality and more bang for your buck.

I have tried 5 items on the menu so far and each time they get better and better. The sandwiches and pizza are wonderful and the happy hour during the week plus all day Sunday is perfect for families.
Never had a bad meal at the place. Today i had a calzone and it was one of the best i ever had. They are very friendly too. Just love this place...

Ate here for lunch today and it was so good! The portions are huge! We ordered a calzone and the antipasto board. It was enough for 2 to share and have some leftover. The antipasto platter had a good assortment, meats, mozarella, olives, roasted red peppers and artichokes. For the calzone, you pick 3 veggies and 3 meats to go inside. It filled the whole plate and came out hot. This is a great spot for a quick but filling lunch!

This place has the **BEST PIZZA IN LAS VEGAS** hands down! I came in for lunch and ordered personal mushroom pizza not having too many expectations as it's very hard to find good pizza in LV. The pizza came out quick and had the most delicious crust. Looking forward to trying some other menu items on my next visit!

Only had pizza and cannolis but will definitely go back for more! I love the flavor in the pizza Bianco and pesto pizza as well delicious! the crust had a perfect amount of salt combined with the chewiness and airiness of the dough. Talk to the owner a couple of times and he was a very welcoming guy!

Plantone's has been on my radar since it popped up on Yelp. I was kind of wondering what kind of experience I would have since the reviews have been mostly good with a few bad reviews. 

When I walked in... It wasn't clear what you were supposed to do... So I was lost for a split second until I saw the arrows on the ground. Basically this is a place where you order and you are given a number and they bring out to the food to you. So as soon as you walk in... Look to your right and walk through the little aisle and look through the menus that are hanging on chalkboards or you could grab and to go menu and look through that instead. 

I was greeted right away and I told them I needed a second as it was first time... And at that point they could've explained the menu to me but instead they just left me alone which ended up being fine as I was ok with just looking through the menu. When I did finally make it up to the cashier I think I surprised her. She had her back to us and jumped about a mile when she turned around and saw us! Lol it was hilarious. :D

I placed my order with her and was given a number... And proceeded to wait. 

The ambiance is actually really cute! They have boxes of dried pasta and jars of olives lining the aisle that your walk to place your order... The only odd item was Cheetos....I would not expect Cheetos in an Italian restaurant. But the music was very fun... Now I can't think of any of the songs that I heard but I remember thinking that it was very cute and very fun Italian music...:) They also have 3 TV's against the wall playing mainly sports. Lots of cute tables with plenty of seating. The only weird thing was a bar type seating in the middle of the dining room... It was weird because when you sit in that bar type seating you are basically looking onto the tables that are lined up against it... If I was sitting at the table beneath it...I would kind of feel a little weird to have a stranger looking onto my table... But all good. I might just be a weirdo!! Lol

They have a decent sized menu with lots of different items on it which I will definitely be back for. 

I got the fried baloney sandwich... Which is basically a fried mortadella sandwich. The menu said ciabatta bread but it was just served on a white bread in the shape of a ciabatta roll. The mustard added the right amount of tang to the sandwich... But I wished that she would've mentioned that I could've added an egg to it...I later saw the pictures of the sandwich with a fried egg and they looked delish!! Overall, it was okay... BUT very very greasy. After I had a couple of bites, my hands and my mouth were covered in grease. Flavor 3.5/5 I also got the Italian pork sandwich with the broccoli rabe.... As soon as I saw the words broccoli rabe I was hooked. The sliced pork was tender but a little on the dry side but Amy the cashier thoughtfully brought us a side of au jus and when I dunked the sandwich into the au jus....omg it was perfection!!! It added so much flavor and a little kick... The broccoli rabe was cooked great so that it wasn't? mushy and had a great bite to it. Overall, the sandwich was a little messy....duh.... You dunk it into the au jus which totally saturated the bread... So worth all the extra napkins that you needed to wipe up the juices dribbling down your chin. Lol flavor 5/5

Will I be back heck yeah! It was delicious! Then why the 4 star instead of a 5 star? Maybe it had to do with the fact that I went there an hour before close but I had to wait a little over 20 minutes to get my food which in my books is a little too long. Hopefully I'll be able to go during lunch one day and see if the wait time is better. :)

I was finally able to return to Plantone's on a Friday night with the entire family to dine in. We sat on the patio and weather was perfect. All the tables and chairs were very clean as well as the patio. No dust or trash or debris. 

As soon as we walked through the door we were greeted by the owner and staff who were all so welcoming. We order our food and took our seats. About 10-15 min our food was delivered to our table. My husband and daughter ordered the chicken fettuccini and my mom ordered the chicken Marsala. I ordered their classic cold sub and it was so fresh. The bread was still crispy and not soggy at all. 

The owner and one of the counter people came around while we were eating to make sure everything was good and can around again towards to end to see if we needed any boxes or anything. 

Everyone really enjoyed themselves being able to hang out and relax on the patio for a delicious dinner. This is going to be one of our regular neighborhood spots. We all loved it.

My favorite Italian place near the house. So far I tried the pizza, the eggplant sandwich, a few kinds of soup and the kids meal for my little and so far I love everything I tasted. They are very nice too. Suggest checking out this place. They also have happy hour. Modern industrial decor, nice patio, ESPN channel and nice music.

Best pizza I've had in Vegas. Their all day Sunday happy hour is a great deal. 

Also, really good tiramisu.

The first thing I noticed when we walked in was that it wasn't the usual sit down kind of restaurant and was more of a cafeteria style.  I was disappointed in the selection of "Italian" food, it was mostly pizza and sandwiches.  The only pasta dish they had was spaghetti with bolognese sauce which included Italian sausage, aka pork. Being that I don't eat pork it left me with only sandwich or pizza options which I wasn't in the mood for, especially when the pizza is pre made and reheated to order, so we left.  I would be willing to give them another try but it would be nice if they had more pasta options.

Wonderful place  to eat with family! The Atmosphere is awesome! Sam is awesome he's the head cook I believe! Roberto & Marina & Amanda are awesome as well great customer Service skills! All of the staff there takes pride in there work!  Great place love, love it!

We were looking forward to trying this deli.  First of all, the parking situation is terrible.  Good luck finding a spot to park.  The restaurant wasn't that busy, there are just so many stores within that shopping center, that parking was hard to come by.  We actually had to park at CVS and walk over.  

My husband and son both ordered the Angry Sicilian.  It was okay and actually the best item that we did order.  However, my son's sandwich was pretty soggy so he ended up just eating the meat and leaving the bread.  I had the Eggplant Parmesan sub and boy was I disappointed.  There was barely any sauce, the bread was very dry, and the eggplant had the skin on it, which was very rubbery and hard to chew.  I ended up cutting the skin off, and just eating the eggplant without the bread.  I would have typically asked for more sauce, but the sauce wasn't all that great either.  Our youngest son had the pasta of the day, which was just spaghetti and meatball.  It was okay, again the sauce was nothing to call home about... especially coming from an Italian family.  We also ordered a pizza to share, again nothing great.  Just really disappointed with our experience.

Location has issues with an extremely busy parking lot. Staff is very friendly. Management/owner continuously circles the restaurant ensuring everyone is happy & satisfied. Salads are larger for eat-in but still good sized & very well priced. The Angry Sicilian large is really big. Stick with the small. Variety on the sandwich is great. Homemade mozzarella is creamy and tasty. Might want to try adding maybe a mustard (something with a little bite) to make it perfect. Only negative is with the pricing. Dinner for 3 (salad, 2 lg sandwiches, 1 soda, 2 beers + 4 cannoli) almost $70. Definitely better tasting than Subway but we could eat at Subway 2+ times for one visit here. Still, very satisfied & will be back to try other menu items.

TL;DR: do yourself a favor and eat here. NOW. Can't afford a trip to Italy? This is the VERY next best thing. Five stars is not enough. 

Just had Plantone's for the first time. Holy F*% it's amazing. I lived in Italy for more than four years. My parents live there now. During my last visit to them, I savored every bite of authentic Italian pizza I could because I thought I'd have to wait at least a year for another taste. Plantone's proved me wrong!!! 

I didn't know what to expect when I ordered my pizza, probably just a decent American style that I would gobble up and not think twice about. Plantone's IS as authentic as Italian pizza gets in the entire United States. The crust had that familiar crispy char, the mozzarella slices (nope, not shredded!!! Also not mozz. di bufala but that would have meant I was dreaming this whole experience anyway) were tossed on with in a lovingly haphazard sort of way that makes each bite different and interesting, the grilled onions (cipolle!!) had a mild but rich, earthy flavor and as soft as butter, the added ricotta and black olives (per amendment by myself , plus, the olives' flavor blew my freakin mind) gave this Bianco Pizza a provincial Mediterranean flavor, cuz ya know... when in Rome... This was, by an embarrassing amount more, the best Italian pizza I've ever had outside of Italy itself. 

I'm pretty sure Plantone's has mastered time travel because, in the measly TEN minutes from placing my order to pickup, they must have flown in this pizza straight from Italy. Next on my "to try" list is their tomato sauce in any form: pizza, pasta, calzone, idgaf. That'll be my ultimate determining factor in Italian authenticity.... hint hint! Simpler is always better, and the only extra ingredient needed is love, something Plantone's excels at! I'm not too worried that I'll soon be dually impressed. 

Two thumbs up! Twelve thumbs up, a HUNDRED thumbs up! Don't change a thing!
This is going to be our new favorite spot in the neighborhood, fresh homemade ingredients and a staff that's very helpful.

Italian hot dog thumbs up, Bolognese sauce thumbs down. 

Atmosphere very nice, people friendly. Parking is terrible. Tad on the pricier side, but not outrageous.

My wife had the Italian hot dog. She's from New Jersey and used to eat them as a kid. She said it  was authentic, but the bread was different than the East. Too much bread. The insides (peppers, potato, onion) very nicely done. Hot dog good quality and good portion.

I had the pasta of the day: fettuccine with bolognese sauce. This was 11 bucks so expected decent quality. Pasta was over cooked and the sauce watery with ZERO taste. Not even red, but at least it was very meaty. Didn't have any salt nor any herbs we could taste. Just bland! Sad. Do not recommend.

We'll try it again because they are new and we live close. Good luck to them, hope they can improve each day.

This place is amazing!!! Staff is friendly and helpful, offering suggestions and answering any questions you may have regarding the menu. They allowed us to sit on the patio with our 2 dogs and even brought out some water for them! I have enjoyed the Italian sausage and sweet peppers, chicken parm sandwich and the caprese sandwich. The chicken parm was great, but a bit much with the bread. The Italian sausage and caprese sandwiches were amazing! Perfect balance of fresh ingredients! I can't wait to come back and try something else new!

First let me say that I am a avid fan of Italian hot dogs having grown up in New Jersey on Jimmy Buffs.  Secondly, the staff here are really nice.  It almost hurts to write this review.  Having said that, here is my experience.  The first time I tried the Italian hot dog it was pretty darn good, not Jimmy Buffs, but the best I had tasted since moving to the west coast. So I went back a 2nd time.  The experience was quite different.  The bread was not as fresh, they changed the brand of hot dog (much saltier and flavorless) the onion and peppers were burnt and the potatoes were more like potato chips.  They redid my order and the potatoes were better, everything was the same.  So one for two, which means I had to try it again.  Maybe that second time was an off day.  So I do return and tell the cook about my previous experience, I wanted to make sure he got it right and politely told him that if it wasn't I would not be returning.  I was really hoping they got it right.  So I ordered my usual. Upon returning to my office hoping it would re-create my first experience,I opened my sandwich and there were no potatoes.   I called and they told me to return, a bit of a hassle, but hey, it happens.  The person behind the counter  was very courteous and even refunded my money, which I thought was good.  However, when I got back to my office, the potatoes were there, but very scarce and like the onions and green peppers, were very greasy.  I tried to eat it but between the salty flavorless hot dog, the lack of potatoes, and the overall greasiness, I was unable to finish it and just threw over half of it in the garbage.

Needless to say I as very disappointed and hope that they can somehow return to the quality and taste I had from the first visit.  If they do, please let me know and I will gladly return.  Otherwise, I'll have to write them off as a place to go for lunch. I would've given 1 star, but the staff are really nice so I gave an extra star for that.

Excellent as always! The food was great and the service was perfection. Kristen, the manager, double "wowed" us with a warm and friendly attitude while Roberto was helpful and kind. We'll be back sooner than later!

$13.50 for a dry, average sandwich, a bag of chips, and a soda? Nah. I'm good. I was excited to try this place because I often went to the previous establishment. The environment is decent and the music is great. But man... that chicken parmesan sandwich was so dry and lacking in flavor. I even added the "fresh mozzarella" - didn't help much. I may give this plan one more shot considering it's 4star rating here among users. Maybe I got the worst thing on the menu? I've had a better sandwich at Subway for 1/2 the cost. 

Tried it again, second time with the same order (to be fair) and the same results. My sandwich was dry, slightly over cooked (or sitting too long), and to me the value is just not there for $12-13. Perhaps I'm ordering the wrong item? I'm willing to give it one more try.  Once again, the service was great. The place is very clean. And I will say my experience was better than last time, I just expect a bit more for that price with a sandwich.

Finally, amazing Italian food on the SouthWest side of town!! 
Ordered the Pizza Piccante - Italian sausage, spicy broccoli rabe, mozzarella 
And Angry Sicilian Sub - Prosciutto, capicola, soppressata, mortadella, mozzarella, red peppers, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, red wine vinegar and oregano.
Their home-made mozzarella is mouthwatering!
The owner Glen is super nice and friendly. He mentioned that many of their products are made in house from scratch. I'm curious to try their fried boloney next.
Nice place which is close to our home. I had pizza and loved the sauce on it. It could be crisper. Hubby had chicken parm and liked. We met the owner and liked him a lot. We will go back again.

Wow!! Such a cute place! I wanted everything on the menu, you have to try the roast pork italian!! Just like back east in Jersey! 

If you haven't tried it you need to go! Congrats and welcome to the neighborhood

We were craving a good sandwich and thought we would try this place out. I'll tell you what.. we were not disappointed here. I had the angry Sicilian, and it was huge with roasted red peppers and fresh mozzarella on it. My boyfriend has a Philly cheese steak with peppers and onions, which he really enjoyed. We also shared a caprese salad that had basil pesto on it, which was so yummy. The service was great, especially since the owner Glenn came out and made sure everything was up to our standards. We will definitely be back for another round of sandwiches. Plus I can't wait to try the pizza.

I don't usually post but don't order any pasta dishes. Family of five, different meals and nothing good. Had high hopes when we were told by the cashier all pasta was freshly made. We had to go next door to Roberto's because no one could finish their food. Extremely mad I spent $75 on a terrible dinner.

We finally decided to make it out to try this place. There are not too many good Italian places in the southwest...this place by far the best Italian in the southwest!! The service, food, and atmosphere was great! They revamped the Mac Shack that was previously there and now it's Plantone's. The atmosphere is really inviting and the design is really nice...it's not an up-scale restaurant per-se but it did have that vibe. 

You can either order up at the counter, or a nice server will come to your table. We got lucky to have Victoriano as our server! He had a great attitude, was very informative, and extremely attentive. He said that they can pretty much make your pasta anyway you like it except for they don't have shrimp, steak, or seafood. He also mentioned that the cooks were trained by an Italian chef, so the food is more authentic. The food was not what we expected, but even better than expected! We ordered the Angry Sicilian and asked for it to be toasted, the Pasta of the Day which was penne (but instead we received Fettuccine, but did not mind) with Bolognese sauce, and a Build your Own Pizza. Everything was hearty and delicious! The Bolognese had plenty of beef and the meats and veggies we ordered on the pizza were fresh and plenty. 

We wanted to eat at the outdoor seating area, but it was breezy so we didn't want our food to get cold. It's spacious and nice out there so we will definitely sit out there next time to enjoy the great food. Happy hour specials are Monday thru Friday from 4-7 PM. They have bottled beer and wine for $4, as well as buy one get one free 10" pizzas. Even if you can't make it out during their Happy Hour, the prices are still very affordable and the portions are big. I'm so excited to come back and try more options on the menu!

Jackpot ! My wife and I stopped in for lunch.    We where immediately  greeted and we're given a menu and some pointers . Fantastic ! I highly suggest the Antipasto Board, it has the best Homemade Mozzarella.

Their menu looks so good, but let me talk about their pizzas! SOOOO GOOD! They are personal pizzas and appear to be baked in a brick oven. They have happy hour every day to include the weekends. I believe Sundays they have happy hour all day. Pizzas (I think you have to select from 3 choices) are half off. I haven't gotten anything else from their bc their pizza was so good ahaha

Originally Stopped By To Apply, But They Don't Have A Full Bar. Although They Do Have Beer & Wine. Stopped By The Next Day (Mostly Because The Guy @ Robert's Gave Me A Horrible Burrito The Day Before) To Try Out One of Their Pastas. It Was Pretty Delicious I'm Not Gonna Lie. It Comes W/ Bread & Butter & They Have Aa Patio W/ A Fire Pit. Lots of TV's Looks Like It's Gonna Be A Good Spot. Good Luck!!

Ordered a large Sicilian thinking it would be big enough for 2-3 people for the price of $14.95 but it wasn't. A little soggy when we took it home. Ordered margarita pizza which was good but cold. But 9.00 for a small sandwich! THats ridiculous! I would of rather of gone to jersey mikes next door!  $34 for 2 sandwiches and a personal pizza is ridiculous!! Sandwiches didn't have much flavor either. Don't know if I'll be back!

They get one star for their fake oven.

And I was so close to having a Neapolitan pizzeria in my neighborhood...why wouldn't they put wood burning in there and leave it gas???

It's because they're as plastic as the sauce and dough they create.

You can tell it's close to being something Italian, I think they're just missing an Italian.

Has a very corporate feel to it and I'm not sure how they're making any money as they have 100 people working there.

I've been here half a dozen times and I've never seen the place have more customers than employees.

Last time I went I had a half decent slice (still below par). I think they actually started using salt!

Went last night instead of SkinnyFats which is in the same center just on a whim. Very glad we did. First time, so we both had lasagna (always a safe choice). It was the best lasagna I have had in a VERY long time. The sauce is as good as it gets, no tomato acid flavors, just so very well done. Staff is very nice and willing to accommodate special requests. Heading there for lunch today to try a sandwich because the guy next to us was having the most delicious looking thing. If I could offer one suggestion it would be add a garlic bread of some sort to the menu. An easy extra 5 dollars or so for the restaurant, and I am sure it would be a great additional revenue stream. Thanks!

This place is great. Easy menu. Order at the counter food comes in a zip. Nice place for the whole family. Kids love the pizza. We ordered for the whole family, pizza, salad, calzone, a beer and a glass of wine. 37$! Never to busy during happy hour. Try The Angry Sicilian for lunch.
Great place to eat amazing food. Best sandwich I have had in Vegas since I moved here. Homemade fresh mozzarella is out of control too. If you want great Italian food, this is the place.

Had a taste for some Italian food late Friday night. At the last minute decided to try Plantones Italian Market.
I was surprised at how good everything was, compared to some of the popular Italian restaurants in Vegas.
Momma's meat lasagna delicious.
Meat platter , fresh and moist mozzarella. Nice cold Stella.
Price much better then the other places and good quality.
This is my new Italian Market.
Mama Mia!!!!
This is the most delicious food ! It's a must try ! Generous portions . Authentic cuisine . Yummy yummy

I ordered the meatball sub and my mom ordered the lobster bisque. The meatball sub was delicious! I had to eat it with a fork and knife because it was pretty big. The lobster bisque was the best I've ever had. It was actually better than the one I had tried at Texas De Brazil. They have awesome specials going every day. Sunday's have all-day happy hour. The atmosphere is very comfortable. It could be a cute date or even just a nice sit-down lunch. They also have a rewards system connected to telephone number that allows for rewards here and there and a free birthday dessert.

The food is very nice here, but I find the portions quite small for what you pay, which is a shame- if it was better value, we would eat here more regularly. I am also concerned by the Keurig machine behind the counter- is that how they make their coffee? If they make their coffee that way, where else are they cutting corners?

My husband ordered the lasagna and said it was perfection. Best he has ever had. I ordered soup and salad. The soup tasted fresh and homemade. The salad was a generous portion and especially good feta cheese and black olives.

We order their Pizza on the happy hour by one 10 inch pizza get one free. Me and my wife did not like it. That was super thin dough that was super soggy. Was not a fan of their Pizza did not try anything else sandwiches do look good

I love this place so much!!! Reasonable price and actually great Italian food. On sundays they have an awesome happy hour menu. I got the spaghetti and meatball today which was really really good. I also got the angry Sicilian sub last time (freaking amazing). 
The employees are also really friendly and helpful.

I just had the pork sandwich with broccoli rabe and sharp provolone and it was delicious! I can't wait to come back to try the meatballs 
Came back and I tried a meatball.....it was delicious! I can't wait to dig into the pork sandwich that I got to go! Thanks Glen!

Excellent customer service. We were greeted immediately by the owner. Very welcoming place. Rustic ambiance with plenty of seating. I had the eggplant sub and my husband had the angry Sicilian. The eggplant sub was very good. It look like a huge boat. I felt like the eggplant was a little undercooked. The pizghetti sandwich at Familia pizzeria is better choice. My husband loves the angry Sicilian it reminds him of a NY deli place. The experience was excellent and food was good. Will definitely return.

First time here last year. Ordered a Tommys tomato pie with spinach to go, and had a beer while I was waiting. The place wasn't to busy, probably because of the rain. Staff were very friendly and helpful. My pizza was amazing. Perfectly cooked, and light, not heavy feel. Will be hitting this place up again for one of the sandwiches, as well as to try out some of the different pizzas they have.

Would not recommend this place the Coke machine had black floaties in the water the oven wasn't hot enough and the pizza dough did not get cooked all the way through manager was too busy interviewing someone to pour wine

After the first bite of my meatball sub I knew I found a special place. I sampled the rest of my family's food and loved everything I tried. It was like discovering Italian food for the first time. The service was great too. We came back the next day just to make sure we weren't imagining things the previous night. It was just as good, even my daughter, who is a picky eater, loved the pizza "Yummy! It tastes like mommy's cooking"

Average Italian food. Mediocre service and staff experience during the lunch hour.  It was actually not busy as we had anticipated.  Regarding flavor - nothing special to go back for. I'd prefer to spend carbs and calories on nicer experiences. My husband ordered a standard pepperoni pizza, and I ordered one of their "specials" Chicken Picatta with a side of fettuccine. We had to ask what kids order as they don't post or advertise a kid's menu. It was like pulling teeth to get an answer. How strange.

This review is in response to my 4th visit an hour ago.(which will be my last) I've ordered the same thing each time. The angry Sicilian sandwich. The signature sandwich. Great sandwich until today. During my 34 minute wait, I counted 12 people behind the counter, none were sure what was happening or what they are supposed to be doing. There were at least 2 managers and the owner there. I hold them accountable, not the staff. Once 30 mins had elapsed, I went to the counter to find my food, they didn't have my ticket or have any idea I was even waiting. After a few minutes, I was handed a bag that contained someone else's order. I was told this is the closest thing we have to your order just take the extra stuff as free. So I did because I couldn't wait any longer. Having had the sandwich before, I expect to see the same thing I've had previously, which contained layer after layer of sliced Italian meats. This one was a fraction of the size, probably one fourth of the previous visits. I never minded paying $18 (includes tip) for a sub, because it delivered. I will not make that mistake again.

I realize that this review is not very well written, please forgive me, my blood is still running hot.

I should have taken this to the owner when I was there, but didn't as I don't like to make a scene and was hot enough to do just that. The two nice ladies sitting next to me sharing their simultaneously similar experience did not help.

Great atmosphere. Good location. Friendly staff.
Besides the red lanterns I don't get an Italian vibe.

I'm a frequent traveler of Italy, so I love to try new places. 

Great meatballs, decent portions. 

Unfortunately, I can't say this place should be considered a market. I came here thinking I could buy a couple items. This is a great concept, but I hope they expand their inventory.

Food is alright nothing special, pizzas are bland the pasta has way to much sauce, tried multiple ones with friends and no one was impressed. And the service was bad, they never come to check on us. Had to talk to a chef for boxes and the check .

So I've tried this place twice and each time it was AWESOME. First time i had the Italian hot dog bc i saw something like it on the "food channel" and that exceed my expectations and my wife had their lasagna and that too was awesome and I personally hate lasagna!!! This last time is saw on the menu "Roast Pork" sandwich and boy did i get excited... I've seen again on the food channel many-a-time Di Nics roast pork sandwich in Philly. Guess what .. i dont need to travel to Philly anymore.  this place just save me HUNDREDS of $$$.  I'm looking forward to trying more items on the menu ... i saw the pizza off other peoples tables and it looked delicious. As i always say "check this place out you might like it"  I know I did!!!

Wow! Stellar customer service! Stellar Italian cuisine. We ordered, there was a miscommunication on our order. They fixed it and went above and beyond as a new restaurant. We will continue our patronage and refer as many people who truly love Italian cuisine

This is our first time ordering from Plantone's. We did take out and, just finished eating our two large Philly cheesesteaks! They were fantastic. Excellent quality steak (I'm guessing it was ribeye?). Thinly sliced, tender, juicy and the perfect quantity. The roll was fresh and around 10" long. We chose American cheese for our sandwiches but they have several other options. Two larges ran $25+, well worth it--excellent quality ingredients. 

The place is nicely decorated to dine in. They're conveniently located on the corner of Warm Springs & Durango. 

The only qualm I had is when I placed my order over the phone, they told me it would be ready by the time I got there. I arrived about ten minutes later and paid. The order was never relayed to the cooks. In turn, I had a brief 7-10 minute wait. But like I said, it was brief and well worth it. Human error, I get it; to err is human. 

I'm excited to order more cheesesteaks from here!

Absolutely wonderful. The food was delicious. The lasagna was full of flavor and no skimping on the meat. The antipasto tray was so yummy. The red peppers were incredible and the house made mozzarella some of the best we have had. The calzone was stuffed from end to end and the bread was wonderful. The price was very reasonable. The owner happened to be there and made the rounds on every table. He seemed to genuinely care about the customers. 

I highly recommend this great place. We will be regulars.

First off, I wouldn't call the bread "Italian bread". I paid for extra turkey and got a drink it was $22. There was barely any turkey at all, and they forgot to put the lettuce. Also stop handing customers those numbers. Nobody wants to touch the dirty number stands. Maybe the pizza is better than the sandwiches
Great atmosphere. Food was delicious! We had the fried bologna sandwich and pizza Bianca. Service was superb! I would drive across town for this restaurant again!

This place is a sleeper.  It's a great price point and great tasting food.  I've been coming for a year now and have never had bad food, or a bad experience.  I'm a huge fan of their meatballs, as they are always cooked well.  I also enjoy the "Tony Pepperoni" pizza.  Menu is diverse and food is prepared fast.  It's a cross between dine-in and order-to-go, so don't be expecting a full service waiter.  I like to grab a Peroni and sit on the patio as I wait for my order.  Enjoy the patio while the temps are cool!

We were not happy. Wanted a pastrami sandwich. Was told don't have that. Wanted a roast beef sandwich. Was told don't have that either. Why do you have those on your website if you don't sell it.  Got lobster ravioli to go and when I walked out of the restaurant all the sauce was out of the to go box and in the plastic.  Asked the girl why they don't have pastrami or roast beef and she said no one orders those. Won't be back.

I am always looking for good Italian places and i happen to come across one! Plantone's puts a lot of thought into their food and decor. I order the caprese salad and add prosciutto on the side. They make their own mozzarella! They make fresh pasta for their pasta of the day! Fettuccine was the pasta of day and I had it with bolognese sauce and added meatballs. The meatballs were tender and flavorful. They didn't skimp on the sauce. They just open in December and i hope they are here for awhile. Next time I am in I want to try their antipasto board.

There's only a very few places that can make sandwiches close to the ones I'm accustomed to in Southern California. The, Andrey Sicilian reminds me of home. A little too pricey for me but all in all a fulfilling sandwich!

Must Go ASAP: the Angry Sicilian was to die for and the Pizza Piccante was amazing...already planning when I can go back again to try something different...the environment is chill and the staff is awesome

First time here, and definitely coming back! 

Dined on a fairly busy night, a decent amount of guests were dining (looked busy from the outside) 

Immediately greeted by a nice girl who asked if we had been here before. We let her know it was our first time and she gave us menus and explained the specials and how to order. 

Ordering was really easy and there was no line at the time. Amy was very helpful with the menu! Also, free refills on drinks so ordering a small cup would be ideal if you don't mind standing up and grabbing seconds! 

Ordered the special which was fettuccine, added Alfredo sauce and chicken. Also ordered a large pesto chicken pizza. In my honest opinion the Alfredo sauce was ok, tasted like mostly cream. Also chicken was chewy, possibly just slightly overcooked? I always try things twice so I'll have to give it another shot next time. The pizza was excellent, not too overwhelming and the dough to topping ratio was perfect. 

Overall I'd recommend this spot if you're looking for a semi casual date or a quick fix if you're craving Italian food that's good quality and moderately priced. They do have alcoholic beverages available as well which was a pleasant surprise. 

 (Spent $40 total for the pasta, large pizza and two small drinks.)

Kristen was very funny, came to our table a few times asking us to tell the owner how awesome she is even though she didn't assist or serve us at all. Definitely added some comedic flare to our dining experience so I went with it. She even wanted me to pull up my Yelp review (I had written and posted it before leaving) to make sure I wrote about her and spelled her name right! I figured she must really need the "brownie points," as she put it, with the owner. Owner ended up giving us some coupons for next time so I guess it was worth it? 

The girl who greeted us (didn't catch her name), Amy, and two servers, and the cooks were all the true superstars. Very helpful and polite, not overbearing by any means and definitely did not fish for unwarranted compliments!

First visit. Delicious food. Reasonable prices. We had ginormous sausage and peppers sandwich, a small pizza, roast pork and broccoli rabe sandwich, Greek salad and a fried baloney sandwich. Everything was just superb. Very nice staff to boot. We all loved our lunch.
Absolutely the best Red Sauce West of the Mississippi!!!

Finally!!! An authentic Italian food place that is convenient to my home! Yes!!! Plantone's is amazing and actually it's pretty dangerous that they are less than a 5 minute drive away because Italian food is one of my all time favorites AND I can never say no to pizza! Like ever! Most recently they have been running some pretty good deals for the people who live in the neighborhood by sending out some mailer coupons and I decided to take advantage of one of the "buy one get one free" specials and wow... Talk about a deal people! 

So since we are talking, can we talk about this Paulie's Pesto Chicken and Pizza Bianca being like one of my all time favorites?  Yes Ma'am!  These two menu item favorites never fail! Always fresh and made to perfection. The Paulie's Pesto Chicken comes with of course: Grilled Chicken, Fresh Basil Pesto, House made mozzarella and EVOO. Pizza Bianca consists of: Grilled Chicken, White Sauce, Caramelized Onions, Fontina Cheese, Grated Parmesan, EVOO. Aside from the food, I just have to shout them out for always having consistent above par customer service! Each and every time I've ordered from here, I have always have an "above and beyond" kind of experience. 

A couple of things I would like to get around to would be to visit them for a dine-in experience and also for the happy hour specials and others that they feature throughout the week! Things like on Wednesday's 50% off all bottles and on Sunday's bottomless mimosas for only $15!

My husband and I have been multiple times now and tried different items each time. The food here is INCREDIBLE! The service is also amazing too. We are thrilled to have this place in our neighborhood!
This place is fresh and delicious . We ordered a margarita pizza and it was yummy . I also ordered there chicken salad sandwich which was also really great ! Bread was soft and food tasted fresh!

The pizza was ok but the sausage and peppers was all soggy and the meat lasagna was overpriced for what it is. And the set up with the menu at doors and nowhere near the cashier was difficult because I don't carry binoculars with me.

Found this place on yelp... so glad I did.  Let me start by saying this place gets it.. and is top notch. 
Amazing quality, really great service from everyone. Prices are very fair especially for what you get. 
I made a pig of myself but you only live once....  we will be back here again.

Being the Owner of Adunja Deals App I always go to the different businesses listed on our Adunja App to see what the food is all about so we can tell people about it properly.  Well all I can say is get here, get here, get here, and get here!  Plantone's food is amazing from the pizza to the pasta to the amazing pizza fires!   You have to stop by and give them a try.  I know you will be coming back over and over.

Found Plantone's by accident and so glad we did!  More of a casual dining experience than a market. Their portions are large and priced right.  The lasagna was amazing and their sauce is delicious.  The Bolognese was a great choice too. Can't go wrong here!

OMG
The make over from the old macaroni place is IMPRESSIVE!!
Loved how it truly is a family Italian experience.
Pizza is fantastic!
Subs are really good 
Wish for a more combination menu option, but that small suggestion os the ONLY critique. Staff super friendly; food super good & great atmosphere!!

It was my first time here and the staff was so nice! They greeted us at the door and explained how everything is fresh! They reserved a table for us right away and they had a DJ tonight! Such a great place! We will be back!

Plantone's Italian Market just opened a few weeks ago but we've already been here multiple times and have loved everything we've tried. This place makes their own dough, sauce, and mozzarella cheese in house. I can't think of anywhere in else in Vegas I've been that has that kind of attention to detail at this price point. The sandwiches are phenomenal as well. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

Roast pork and broccoli rabe sub could not have been better! A taste of the east coast so close by. Go! Eat here! Service was awesome too. Very accommodating. The photo is my husband's meatball park sub.

Went here a couple of days ago. Been hearing great things about the Fried Bologna Sandwich. And I got to say, it was pretty excellent.
