I got mine with the fried egg on it,  which was a bit messy but oh so good. The owners were there and checking in on everyone's experience which I thought was a nice touch. I also ordered a piece of Tiramisu for dessert. It was a bit expensive for the size but overall a good Tiramisu. But that's not the reason I would go back. I would definitely go back to have that sandwich again though.

Awesome place! I've been coming here for about 7 months now, and I love it! This is a great place to come in for lunch or to even have a casual dinner. There is plenty of seating inside the restaurant; there is also an outdoor patio for additional seating should you choose to soak up some of that sweet Vegas sun.

On to the menu--I'm a little embarrassed to say that I've only tried 1 item on the menu in the 7 or 8 times I've been here. The meat cal-zone; it's big, it's meaty, and super cheesy! But more importantly, for $12 it gets me full which is incredibly rare now-a-days. I'll be trying different menu items soon to diversify my taste buds a bit.

The owner, Glenn is awesome. He's usually in on Fridays and is very well connected with his customers. He makes his rounds and checks to see that they're satisfied.

This place is also a speakeasy for real estate deals. If I was a betting man, I'd be willing to bet that there are more real estate deals getting done in here than there are that get done in some brokerage offices.

#MAGA

Amazing food. Great selection of Italian specialty items. Owned by actual Italians. Heard Tony Plantone is from my home town of Rochester, New York. Beyond excited about this place!!! Had the roasted veggie sub and spinach salad. Tasted like home. Literally.
I absolutely LOVE this place. The food is so good and the portions are big so you can even share a plate of you wanted. I always come here when craving Italian food and always satisfied!!

This is a deli. Let me state this is actually a great deli! You traditionally order at a counter and they bring it to your table. Extra bonus for the outdoor patio set up which is super cute.

Let me start by saying it's super clean... I love that! The owner came to our table politely engaged in conversation and gave my daughter a nice little gift. What a great guy and great staff- everyone was happy and enjoying what they did. I feel like if you're going to go to any italian place, this is how it should be or why bother.

That being said $80 including tip got us the following:

* a bottle of pink moscato which was cheap Barefoot but I didn't care because it was half off during happy hour.
*A big ass Caesar salad with chicken added
*Kids cheese pizza meal which included chips and a drink.
*Spaghetti and meatballs.
*Lobster ravioli.
*Meat lasagna which was definitely the fave.

We really liked getting in and getting out quickly with a little one while still enjoying a good from- scratch dinner! 

This is my new go-to for quick authentic Italian!

WOW! Came during the grand opening of Plantone's. For being the grand opening it went smooth. No craziness going on there. Got in and was seated fast. The service was wonderful and the staff is friendly. The place is awesome with the cool decor. 

We ordered mozzarella caprese which was delish. Tomatoes so fresh and that mozzarella mmmmm. The hubby ordered the pizza with pepperoni and sausage. Crust was just right. Not burnt or under cooked. He said that his pizza was great cheese and sauce just right. I ordered the spaghetti bolognese. WOW was that just delightful. Flavors all around for just a simple pasta. 

Plantone's has a new pasta everyday. So it would be awesome if I could try their new pasta everyday. Lol! The price is very reasonable. Not no crazy Italian price which will empty my wallet. So maaaaybe I can go everyday and try their different kind of pasta.

Have eaten at Plantone's several times and even taken it home! Highly recommend the Angry Sicilian sandwich or any calzone or pizza! While you're there grab a yummy hot dog! Yes, you heard me.... a hot dog! Talking about them makes me want one now! 

Great neighborhood restaurant with terrific food and a super staff! Trust me I'm picky so give them a try!

We ordered the pizza fries and honestly what a cool idea. Fries were perfect crispy and hot and soft with tones of cheese and we added tomatoes kind of like a margarita pizza and the sauce they put is bomb! Wish i would of had more sauce added to it.

Updated:
A few of us went back a second time to this place for lunch last week. I went on the web site and placed an order for a cheesesteak. I had a lot of specific requests for my sandwich. I arrived at the restaurant around 12:10pm and went to the cashier to pay for my order. The manager, who didn't know that I was standing behind him told the cook,  to double check the special requests. I then told him that it was my order. He advised me that my order will be ready in a minute or so. The sandwich was delicious!  Several minutes later, the manager came up to my table and asked me if the order was made correctly.  I really hope that this place keeps up the great work with regards to the food and service. I'll be definitely returning here again for the third time in a few more days! Thanks..

My husband was 3rd in line at their grand opening to get a weekly free pizza for a year. So we should be visiting this wonderful neighborhood establishment at least on a monthly basis. 

The employees are very helpful from when they greet you at the door and when leaving the restaurant. 

Our first visit to Plantones was right before the grand opening. I guess it is common place for many restaurants to do this for training purposes as the employees were getting acclimated to their new environment. During this first visit, a few mistakes were made, but to our advantage. My husband had ordered a 10" pizza with chicken pesto and all the veggies except jalapeños. Instead, they made the large pizza and added jalapeños. No big deal since they didn't charge us extra for the large pizza and we could easily pick off the jalapeños.

On our second visit, the first Friday to claim our free pizza, it was right at lunch time. Big mistake. Super busy. We waited in line for a good 13-minutes.  I almost feel that this could be improved as there are two windows.  So because it took so long to get through the line, I expected a long wait on our pizza as well.  I actually turned on the stop watch on my phone, went to the nice and clean restroom, got back to the table and within 4-mins and some seconds of waiting, the pizza arrived. Now this time does not include getting a drink and finding a table. So if anything, it took no more than 6-mins, which is still really good considering the lunch crowd.

Be sure to save room for dessert. The cannoli and tiramisu is fabulous.

Also, be sure to order a drink. They have the fun coke machines. So far, my husband's favorite concoction is strawberry vanilla coke.

Great start Plantones! Keep up the good work.

From the moment we walked in, we were greeted and the staff were all extremely nice. My son ordered a 10" pie and my daughter and I had a whole pie. The pies were served very quickly (to my surprise). I really enjoyed my dinner with the soft Italian music that was playing. I will definitely keep coming back to try all their different dishes. I think tomorrow I will try the pastrami sandwich on rye.

This Italian joint is the truth! Fresh, high quality, solid portions and reasonable prices. Was referred to this place by a friend and man I was impressed to say the least. Ordered a 10" margarita pizza to share for an appetizer which was amazing the dough was definitely home-made and the amount of sauce was just right. I also had the angry Sicilian sandwich which was made with high quality cold cuts prosciutto, mortadella, capicola with fresh mozzarella to die for! My buddy ordered the chicken parmesan hot sandwich that looked mouth watering (his rating was 5 stars) During my visit the owner Glenn introduced himself was very friendly and accommodating. He offered me a coupon worth 5$ off my next visit and also have me his business card! Needless to say excellent dinning experience. This is the Italian lunch/dinner spot that gets you in and out and doesn't lack one bit on quality!

A great Pizza! We had the large margherita. Crust was light and soft with just the right amount of Char and chew. The fresh mozzarella was perfect. with just the right amount of natural salt like eating milk. The san marzano sauce was rich and flavorful with a delicious tomato taste without being overly spiced like some places feel they have to. This pizza let the tomato taste shine through. Excellent! Cannot wait to return.
                                  Dave C

First visit and maybe I will give it another try but doubtful. I had the regular Italian sausage and peppers, my grand daughter had the regular meatball sub. Now I judge all Italian sausage subs against Portillos in Chicago, compared to that this was a grade C at best. The sausage was the size of a hot dog, dry and shriveled up. The peppers had no spice at all. The meatball sub consisted of two medium size meatballs very little sauce and you have to pay extra for mozzarella cheese...really on a meatball sub. The thing had such little sauce there was none on the plate after an 11 year old kid ate it, you know kids ain't especially careful when they eat. Two subs and two small fountain drinks 22.00 dollars. That's a little pricey no chips come with subs. They do serve it with pickles but who eats Italian subs with dill pickles.
Anyhow maybe it was an off night so like I said may try them again some day. Oh and parking is a nightmare had to park over by CVS.

First time trying this place. There was a fair amount of people in there for a Sunday around 11am. We were headed to another spot but smelt the brick oven pizza from our parking spot so decided to try this place out. We are all about trying new spots and welcome small business over chain restaurants. The decor is inviting and rustic it definitely has an Italian vibe. 
We ordered the Quattro formaggio slice and the mamas margherita slice as well as a Caesar salad. The pizza was fair although not nearly as warm as we wished they had served it. Victor the server provided us fresh ground pepper on our salad which we appreciated. He also made a few routine stops by our table to check on us and grab us ranch dressing and a knives. We found victor helpful and prompt in our requests. 

However the woman who took our order was unpleasant and rude, her name tag said Maria. There was a point while we were dining that a secondary margaherita slice landed on our table, we mentioned we didn't order the secondary slice and that we had our full order, the slice landed on our table by mistake. We left the slice there as we knew it didn't belong to us, about 3 minutes later Maria came over to our table and removed the slice and placed it on another table, without saying a word. We found that extremely strange and quite rude. I felt awkward for the other table and their slice of pizza was left sitting on our table prior to being served to them. 

The owner arrived near the end of our dining and he was very sweet, he gave us his card and mentioned a few things about his new restaurant. We will definitely come back because the food was good, the restaurant was clean and the owner was great. Hopefully they figure out the food running and tell their staff to be more friendly (aside from victor he was great).

All I have to say is please check your order before leaving if your ordering out. I've been here twice and each time my order was incorrect. First I ordered a turkey and cheese sub got home half the ingredients I asked for weren't on the sub. But I get it things happen so when I went again I informed them and all the guy said was " oh but it must have been good your back again" smh but anyway I ordered what I thought was chicken parm but when I got home it was what look like beef a Roni with a piece of chicken on top. I didn't know chicken parm came with beef. I couldn't even eat it.

I have been by a couple of times now and wish there was a location closer to my side of town. Pasta, pizza and sandwiches are all good options here. Inside they have regular tables as well high-top half booth/half stool seating. You order at the front counter and they bring your order to you. Staff is friendly and food is made fresh to order, so it might take a moment until it's ready especially if you order certain pastas, but it's worth it. 

Philly Cheesesteak ($7.50 for small) - Steak, onions and your choice of cheese. This was actually the sandwich that brought hubby and I here. The other pictures we had seen showed the sandwich had a good amount of steak in it. Sadly the one we had was mostly onions. The bread and onions tasted good, but where's the beef?! If this were the only thing we ordered, I am positive we'd have not come back. Thankfully the pizza I also ordered for us to share tasted really good! 

Tony Pepperoni ($4.50/slice) and Mama's Margherita ($3.50/slice) - Wow these are some huge slices! They gave be a big rectangular pizza box just for the 2 slices, which aren't the usual shaped slice. Both pizzas tasted great and the price was very fair. 

Angry Sicilian ($14.95 for large) - Prosciutto, capicola, soppressata, mortadella, house-made mozzarella, roasted red peppers, lettuce, tomato, onion, evvo, red wine vinegar and oregano on an Italian loaf. Yes, all that! This is one tasty sandwich and the bread holds everything in nicely. I could barely eat half and will only get the smaller one next time unless I am sharing with someone. 

Momma's Meat Lasagna ($12.95) - Pasta sheets that are made in-house are layered with a beef, pork and veal mixture, ricotta, sauce and shaved parmesan. This came with a couple pieces of garlic bread. The lasagna and bread were both good. I can't say I was feeling "wow" over it, but it was good and the price was fair. 

The cold sandwiches can be made a lettuce wrap if you'd prefer and since the food is made to order a lot of menu items can be customized if you want to leave something out or maybe even add something. They serve beer and wine and have weekly specials that are worth checking out.

If you survive the whole finding-a-parking-space ordeal, this restaurant has pretty good food. Went on a Saturday afternoon. Lasagna was $15 a plate, which I'd expect to pay at Olive Garden....not here. The pizza was tasty and cheesy, and points for the happy hour specials on food. A very disappointing beer selection though. Keep your expectations low, and you'll leave happy.
Meat balls were very delicious although the pasta was flavorless and the lentil soup was way too salty lol I may try their pizza next time

Amazing! Reminds me of a east coast deli! Really enjoyed it. My husband had a pizza and I had a panini. Both were delicious. The staff was super nice and made sure we were happy. I look forward to going again

It really kills me to give it 2 stars especially since I was really excited to try this place. 


l'll start with the positive things

I really liked the location of this place, great real estate choice. My husband and I really liked the interior of the restaurant, it has a modern touch to it. The place was clean and looked new inside ( because it is new) so we really liked that. Also the chicken with my meal was good but i'll elaborate on that so continue reading.

Now for the negative

WHERE THE HELL IS THE MARKET?!?!?! It can't possibly be the display area with the chips.

So when you walk in its hard to see and read the menu. They have them posted up high and the print is small so it's hard to see and read but no big deal. We did notice that they had 3 huge screens by the front door which we are assuming are meant to display the menu in bigger print but it wasn't on. We were in a pasta mood but they didn't really have many pasta options which was a bummer. Aside from the lasagna that seems to be a regular on the menu we ordered from the "specials" menu which was pretty much a protein (chicken or sausage) prepared differently, served with fettuccini and different sauce according to the protein option.
I ordered parmesan chicken with fettuccini. My husband got a pasta with sausage and a pink sauce I think it was. My husbands sausage (see what i did there) was thinly cut which wasn't the problem but it looked and had the texture of mushrooms. The sausage had no texture and the sauce was more on the goopy side and bland. My dish was better, but not by much. I will say my chicken parmesan was good. The chicken was moist, was salty, saucy and cheesy. The pasta / fettuccini however was a different story. I felt as if the pasta was more of an afterthought, didn't feel like it went with my meal which is weird and its such a simple dish which is why I was disappointed and slightly confused. Also the sauce was........ good/ fine, it wasn't greasy or gross which is a good thing but I was turned off by a metallic/electric cooker taste.


Maybe pasta isn't their thing and maybe their subs, pizza or calzones are the better options. This place has soooooo much potential but the entire restaurant is sort of confusing, I thought it was a sit down and order type of place but its an order and then sit type of spot which I think they should switch that up ( due to trendy ambiance and size) but not a deal breaker.  Honestly thinking about it now the place reminded me of Sbarro with a cool and trendy interior. Not sure if its worth the money to get Sbarro quality food in a trendy joint. This is probably the thanks I get for not cooking this evening.

ANGRY SICILIAN!!

Plantone's Italian Market is a fantastic addition to the Southwest side of Las Vegas, where we tend to miss out on some of the better Italian joints such as Roma or Nora's, especially when in need of a quick bite. Featuring Italian sandwiches (ANGRY SILICILIAN!), thin crust pizzas, and a daily handmade pasta special (as well as an always available lasagna), this converted location of Mac Shack brings a lot of variety.

Italian meats are often procured in Las Vegas from Boar's Head, and Plantone's doesn't hide the fact that they use their meats. I've tried a couple of the sandwiches here, including the Angry Sicilian and the Plantone's Parma. At 15 dollars for a 10-inch sub, these are some pricier sandwiches, and I'm not sure you can get by on a 6-inch size sub either. 

On the ANGRY SICILIAN!, they absolutely heap on the meats - Prosciutto, Capicola, Soppressata, and Mortadella all come together along with house-made Mozzzarella, Roasted Red Peppers, and some of the other normal trimmings. If you're coming here for the first time, GET THIS SANDWICH! It's absolutely delicious and my mouth waters just thinking about it. And I absolutely love the Italian bread here. I generally like my sandwich breads soft, and this is by far the softest bread I've had for an Italian sandwich. I can't recommend this sandwich enough.

The Plantone's Parma is also a tasty sandwich, but it only has imported Prosciutto - there's more of it than on the other sandwich, but since Prosciutto is rather expensive, you don't get that same kind of heartiness in this versus the SICILIAN(!). In the end, I felt a little hungry and less excited about this variety.

One of the most particularly enticing options at Plantone's is their homemade daily special pasta. They offer one particular type of pasta, such as fettuccine or pappardelle, in one of their variety of sauces. During our second visit to Plantone's, we decided to get the fettuccine bolognese that was available for the special. At 10.95 for a medium-sized portion at best, it's not the cheapest pasta around but the noodles here are special. The fettuccine was unlike any that I've had before - on the thicker side and somewhat wavy in nature with an unevenness that suggests it was indeed made by hand. Handmade fresh pasta also tends to be a little softer than the dried noodles we generally have available to us, so it may not be as appetizing to some as others. The bolognese sauce was average in my opinion - the sauce was tangy and meaty, but lacked a certain depth to it. Maybe it was simply a little bland. Some grated Parmesan cheese would have gone a long way to add some nuttiness. Granted, I'm not sure they have some available or not as I did not remember to ask.

Service here was good for both our visits - someone greets you at the door and explains what's available and where to order, though they can get a bit wordy. Food is brought out to you if you dine in, and they offer boxes for whatever type of food you ordered.

I'll be back soon to try their pizza. Also, ANGRY SICILIAN!

I am always interested when I see an Italian Market has opened up in the area and try to check it out to see what they offer. I made the trek across town to see what they have to offer. When first walking in it was a bit confusing. There was a pizza selection as part of a long counter top where the other food options are. You have to walk to the front of the line to find a menu or see the boards with other food options, little confusing if you haven't been before. I thought it was just me but the other people behind were just as confused.
A market
-The highlight of the trip was the Italian Broccoli sandwich with sharp provolone and an Italian bread. We decided to have the pork on the side and I'm glad we did, it wasn't very good.not much flavor and the au ju it sat in really lacked the basics, not even a hint of salt. The broccoli was cooked perfectly and seasoned just about right, I prefer a strong garlic taste in mine but that's just preference. This is my go to sandwich when I travel back to Philly(not a cheesesteak) so it was definitely comforting.
-After seeing some photos I decided to try the meatball sandwich. It was on more of a homemade roll, very light and airy, with two meatballs and way too much sauce. It was just middle of the road for me, nothing outstanding and there are definitely better meatballs out there. Seemed like there should be less sauce and more meat
I would try some other menu items if I am in the area but would not go out of my way to come back.

You order your food at the counter. 
You look at the little grocery section. 
You find your own table. 
Then wait for your food to arrive.
**It's a cross between a dine-in restaurant & a fast food restaurant**

PROS:
* The staff was super friendly & offered to suggest some of their top sellers.
* The place is quite spacious.
* It took a reasonable amount of time for our food to come out.
* They have a wide selection of options


CONS:
* The food, it was just okay =/
Delicious food! Good sized portions. Food came out nice and fast. Let's see we had the cheese pizza, antipasto appetizer, chicken parmesan with fettuccine marinara. Good stuff all around.

This restaurant was originally going to be called "Tony Baloneys"
They changed the name just before they opened. 
I had a taste for a fried Bologna sandwich I haven't had in years.
I had the best fried bologna sandwich i've ever had and that's no NO BOLOGNA!

For a strip mall Italian place, it's very good. The inside is comfortable and nice. Had the pasta of the day -- meat sauce -- and the noodles were clearly homemade and good. Cannoli was good as well. I hope the place succeeds.

Decided to try this place tonight for the first time with my boyfriend, so happy we did! The second we walked into the restaurant, Roberto immediately greeted us with a warm smile and a welcoming attitude! He was so kind in answering every question we had and telling us all about the menu! The great service didn't end there, the rest of the workers were equally as helpful and kind including the girl who took our order (Tall, brunette), who also went out of her way to help my boyfriend in getting a diet drink when their soda machine was out. Roberto also came back to the table to ask if we enjoyed our food, clear the table, and offered assistance in anything else we needed. The entire staff was great and the food was on a new level. The presentation was so pretty and it tasted just as good as it looked! We will absolutely be coming back, as we live not even a mile away.

Plantone Italian Market is a new fast & casual Italian restaurant that opened in the Southwest (Durango and Warm Springs) back in December. They took over the old Mac Shack location and rennovated the inside. Had a great experience there and wanted to share with everyone. The staff there were all super friendly, the food was tasty and had good value. We shared a Caesar salad and a huge Mushroon/Sausage Calzone (total $16). Apparently they make everything in-house, their pastas, sauces, etc. They have pizzas, subs, calzones, salads and other quick italian fare. Give it a try if you're in the area.

You're not going to find fat-stacked sandwiches like Plantone's many other places in this city. The Angry Sicilian is exactly what I was hoping for. The Roast Pork Italian had all the pluses of a dipped sandwich with none of the soggy messiness of eating a dipped sandwich. For a slice of pie, they sure give you a lot. I'm definitely going to try happy hour 4-7 for 2-for-1 pizzas. But as much as I loved the food, I think I may have fell in love with the tatted girl behind the counter even more.

Today we preserved chicken parm,chicken Alfredo,margherita pizza,and the new pizza fries. We were the first to order them.  Pretty tasty those pizza fries were that we almost ate them all. Service was excellent,chicken with both meals was perfect,pasta just right,pizza was as fresh as you can get right down to the crust. They have an outside area to eat that seats 30 people with heat lamps.

Two things about this restaurant that makes it great:  1)  it is a local business, and I love local businesses. 2)  Glenn, the owner extraordinaire, is at the restaurant meeting and greeting guests; even addressing some by name. It's a "Cheers" environment, for sure. And I am happy it is!  I had the eggplant Parmesan and spinach salad. I'm not an Italian food connoisseur, but it was delicious!  It wasn't overly saucy so I was able to taste the layers of eggplant. It had a modest amount of Parmesan, just my style. My son had the cheese pizza, very simple yet flavorful. Plantone's also caters and I am looking forward to calling in an order for our next event. I'm definitely coming back to sample the pizza fries, caprese, and chicken Parmesan.  This place also has a happy hour with white wine at $3, and red wine at $4. During happy hour their pizza slices are $3 as well. Having a neighborhood Italian "joint" makes me happy. Who doesn't love great Italian food?

If you're looking for a nice warm friendly place to eat check out Plantone's, I don't think you'll be disappointed. We checked this place out last night looking for something quick but not really fast food. This was perfect. They had a decent size menu for their everyday dishes but also offer daily specials. My friend was impressed with the decor as soon as we walked in, I didn't notice right away because I was looking at the sample pizza pies they had set up to help you with your choice. They offer hot and cold subs and theone that stood out was the Angry Sicilian which I didn't get but probably will next time. Also the antipasto will also be for next time. What we went with was the Pizza Picante for me which was sausage and a broccoli rabe and house made mozzarella, so good and my friend had the lasagna which came highly recommended by the gentleman that took our order. My friend loved her lasagna amd raved about how delicious it was and how fresh the cheese was.  We also met the owner last night, very engaging and definitely passionate about his restaurant and cares about the product he puts out. This place is also a market so you can buy what you need for a homemade meal you may want to cook and if you're a mustard lover, go here for it, we sampled an amazing mustard that was delicious, I dipped my pizza crust in it but it's perfect for subs. Please check out this local family restaurant, you won't be disappointed!
Every time I come in I have friendly staff to assist. Any item I have ever ordered has been delicious. Great flavors and amazing food.

Delicious! I had the Angry Sicilian sub and it was exactly what i was looking for! House made mozzarella and meat overflowing! Can't wait to try everything else! The Roasted Pork Italian hot sub is next on my list! 

Staff was friendly, restaurant was clean, great atmosphere, and my group had a great time! 

Definitely a must try for any Italian food lover!

Four adults and one youngster met for dinner recently and it turned out to be a disappointing experience.  Save for the pizza bianca, the rest of the meal was less than satisfactory.  The pizza had a good cheese flavor and the caramelized onions gave it a good taste.

The sauce with the fettuccine was watery.  Just getting some on my plate resulted in several tomato spots on my shirt.  The pizza fries was a conglomeration of steak fries, tomato sauce, cheese, and meatballs.  It was a gloppy mess.  The fried ravioli were OK but they were almost identical to the ones I get on the buffet at the Suncoast.  

I'm glad I didn't have to cut a slice from the dessert calzone because the crust almost had to be torn to get through it.

While I didn't do the ordering, you look at the menu board near the entrance and then walk down the counter to the far end and place your order.  It's seems a bit inconvenient.  You then get a stand with a number for the table and they bring your food when it's ready.

We got small plastic cups and went to the Coke machine to get water.

All in all, an experience that won't be repeated.

If you're ever home sick ...and miss the great Italian east coast eats....well..Plantones will make you and your tummy very VERY happy. The Angry Sicilian is hands down the best Italian sandwich  I've had in my 13+ years in Vegas.

Please come and support the LOCAL MOM/POP Restaurant....they are doing it right!!
Sorry no photos. Had Chicken Marsala and Calzone. Excellent. Make sure to stop by. Delicious.
Great place! Loved the eggplant parm sandwich. Highly suggest it!

Came on a Thursday night. Really cramped parking lot, but I got lucky and was able to find parking up front. Menu is pretty simple.
I ordered the angry sicilian sandwhich. Great sub. Fresh baked bread, loaded with Italian meats and cheese. Even veggies fresh. Huge portion for the price. Even my boyfriend liked it, and he complains that sub sandwiches here are nothing like east coast subs. He said it reminded him of a Jersey sub. 
The thai chilli wings were very good. I was not expecting from an Italian spot. Wings were moist and juicy, and crunchy. The sauce was on the side since I ordered to go, and that was perfect. Ohh and ranch was amazing, tasted homemade. I will probably order extra next time as it was great dunking sauce for sub too!
This place is out of the way, but I will def be back to try another fantastic sub!

My prior review of this restaurant was one star due to an incident that happened when we arrived.

Shortly after, we received correspondence from the owner Tony, who apologized for any misunderstanding and very warmly invited us to try and be part of the Plantones family again.

Today my wife and I went in and tried this place again.  

This time, we were greeted by Tony himself and given a tour of all this place has to offer.  First thing we noticed was the decor, as it is well decorated and has a very warm and inviting feel.  This is very different than when MacShack had residence here, in a good way.  

Inside there is a very nice looking structure of multiple cabinets that features grocery style items for this type of food that can be purchased, and of course on the other side is the restaurants food.

Tony had us try a few different options, including pizza, a sandwich that was some kind of Italian Pork sandwich, the angry Sicilian sandwich and a peppers and sausage sandwich.

KILLER FOOD!

The pizza you can tell is home cooked and full of flavor. We got the pepperoni one and noticed the quality ingredients from the first bite. 

My wife and I split part of the Italian pork sandwich and I have to say, it was one of the best tasting sandwiches I've ever had.  It was full of flavor and juice and topped with some kind of greens (broccoli, maybe asparagus?) but it was fantastic.

For my meal I got the sausage and peppers sandwich and it was incredible.  The sausage was a bit spicy but not in a way that would overwhelm the flavor.  Fans of this type of sandwich may just find this is a new favorite spot.

My wife ordered the large angry Sicilian.  It was huge, she had to take most of it home.  Pilled high with various meats and cheese, this is the kind of sandwich you always see pictures of in ads. Most time the real thing never lives up to the picture, but this certainly keeps its reputation. I highly recommend it!

Aside from amazing food and service, this place also features ice tea as a drink and has a the newer style sofa fountain where you select your own soda then flavoring from Coca Cola products.  My wife had her Vanilla Coke while I enjoyed the Orange Coke.

Highly recommend this spot, bring some friends and family and enjoy the amazing experience ! 

The patio looked beautiful, but it was cold and raining when we went, so maybe next time.
Amazing cold cut sandwiches, great pizza and salads. Good quality ingredients as you would find on the east coasts.

Wife had the Bianca pizza slice, I had the chicken Parmesan sub. Staff is excellent and very friendly. We ordered a tiramisu dessert at the table and didn't have to walk to the register at all. Pizza, was great, sub was eh. The sub was a little bland, but overall we are happy with this place. Slice pizza, 10" sub, soda, and dessert = $26.

Our group was craving some real soothing and filling food, so Italian is great for answering that longing call. Plus with all most of our group of ladies wanting wine; this ultimately was in the cards. Italian food and wine pair so deliciously together. One of the ladies in our group lives close to this restaurant so we would not have far to drive home after dinner being so close to her house. Then, after dinner we all drove back to her house with leftovers, and continued the party at her house.

Our group was seated in the patio area and it was late enough in the evening that the heat was not an issue. Those nightly Vegas breezes that come from the mountains are amazing too out here on the patio. The restaurant is very warm and pleasant with a modern edge in architecture. On the front landscape they use desert plants to decorate such as the huge agave as you walk in the front door. The color scheme they use is a mix of brown that makes the restaurant very appealing and clean feeling. The staff are very considerate and friendly too.

Most of us started with white wine and then when dinner came, since most of our glasses were empty we switched to Sangrias. We dined here on a Wednesday too, so we received a wonderful surprise  on wine , going with the bottle was amazing. Our Sangrias bottle was half price, so we ordered two bottles with eight of us. For dinner we ordered two 10 x 18 pizza with three toppings each. The first one had pepperoni, feta, and mushroom. The second pizza had mozzarella, olive, and feta. Their pizzas are very delicious too.

Our server delivered flawless service to our group and was so polite. She constantly continued to ensure that we had all we needed with such a large group of guests. The pizzas that we ordered for our extra extended party later at the house were all correct. Our server was the one who prepared that order as well. The order was flawless and those pizzas were divine. The service was exceptional and food excellent and our little event went very smoothly. Can't wait till next time!

I was around and look for something to eat really quick. Saw the Italian market and walk in. Place is not to busy and the cashier came to welcome me . I asked for something healthy and he recommended a Greek type of pizza at $7 . Kind of pizza with a Greek salad on top.. oops, I forgot to ask "no feta"... my bad. I put it on the side. Surprisingly it was very good and there is nothing bad to say about this place since service is good and the food was good for the price.

I was really excited to try this place as I live near it and love Italian food. Unfortunately I have nothing good to say about Plantone's, the ordering/line is confusing, there's no "market" at all and the food is tiny (which is especially insulting based on the high prices here).

I wanted to really like this place but i was underwhelmed. 

Living in the Southwest its nice to see a fresh new restaurant pop up in hopes of that i can add it to my regular rotation. Fair warning to those that walk in and wait to be seated like me, its the kind of place where you grab a menu and order at the counter to the right where they give you a number. I ordered the Italian Hot Dog, as i try not to order the same ol' staple items you can see on any menu. It came out looking like a loaf of french bread split down the middle, with bell peppers, onions and potato chips pouring out of it. It honestly didn't look appealing so i hoped it was better in taste upon the first bite, 70% peppers and onions, a few potatoes and no hotdog. Second bite was similar, and i could tell it was not going to be a meal that i would enjoy. I took the sandwich apart and removed 50% of the vegetables as they were very mushy and bland, and positioned the hotdog so that it could add some flavor to the sandwich and mask the vegetables. I got through the sandwich/hotdog, but it wasnt enjoyable at all. Its a possibility that i simply ordered the wrong thing on the menu, but im a strong believer that if its on the menu it should be worth eating at least. I may give this place a try in my future but i will not rush back as there are plenty of places within a short distance  of here that has consistently good food across the entire menu. The patio is cute, and the employees were friendly, and im sure the pizza isnt bad but that hotdog might need some rethinking or at least a different preparation of at lease the vegetables.
My husband and I went to Plantone's Italian Market tonight.  Everything was excellent!  We will definitely be back.
Service is exceptional & staff is so nice, smells amazing! So good! Must try the antipasto plate!

My whole work staff ordered from here and the food was not good... at all. 
We actually all ordered something different too so it wasn't a fluke with one item. Everyone felt sick the rest of the day and one of my coworkers actually threw out his sub and went to jersey mikes instead.
The Philly cheesesteaks were super greasy and almost burnt with little to no cheese and all the pizzas we ordered were flat out gross and inedible. 

I'd never come back here

Mac shack needs to come back asap

Honestly it wasnt so-so, I had the fettuccine alfredo and my gf had the chicken parmesan fettuccine.

The alfredo needed a bit more salt but the quality of ingredients was really good.

The chicken parm on the other hand needed way more salt, you can taste the quality but there isnt enough taste in the first place! Sauce needed it and so did the chicken.

Otherwise I would come again for the pizza maybe.
Amazing pizza! Amazing pasta! Amazing service!!! we will definitely return! the fire pit outside is such a cozy addition. perfect for date night or dinner with the whole family.

My first time here,  but what I had was really delicious. The owner was here talking with customers. He seems like a nice guy.

I ate the 10" roast pork Italian with broccoli rabe. I've seen this sandwich on TV shows and it always looked delicious, so I was excited to find a place that had one. I've never had one, so can't compare if it's "authentic" or whatnot.

This sandwich has sharp provolone and au jus on it. I would have liked a small side of the juice to come out with the sandwich by default, but the sandwich was by no means dry. The bottom was soggy just how I would expect. The pork was juicy and sliced thin. It was basically like a French dip, but with pork instead of beef, and some rabe on top. 

I can't wait to come back to have another one of these! It's very filling, so if you don't eat much, maybe go with a 6".

Ordered a 10 inch four cheese pizza at 8:13. wasn't served until 8:45. Bottom of the dough was still..dough..not cooked throughout. Very disappointed as I live in the neighborhood and heard great things. The cheese was good though.

Went to Plantone's on 02/11/18 about 6:30, what a great place to eat. The set up is really cozy,great menu to choose from. Took 2 of my boys and they really like the 3 meat pizza and the Caesar salad. It was perfect portions for us. (4) Tv's on playing the Las Vegas Knights and the Winter Olympics.. First time visiting and we will be back.

I've been pretty excited to see an authentic Italian shop open down the street from me. Sometimes I cringe when I see the prices but it really comes down to the flavor.

I've had the pleasure of trying their Alfredo pasta during my first visit. You can absolutely taste the texture difference of the pasta of how it is homemade versus store bought. It was soft, maybe too soft for some people's liking, flavorful and just delicious. They packed in garlic in the sauce and it's exactly the way I would've wanted it.

I tried the Roast Pork Italian hot sandwich. I did wish to have a small cup for a little more au ju to dip my sandwich in, but it surprisingly remained slightly moist the whole time. I'm not usually a big fan of broccoli rabe with the bitterness but it perfectly countered the pork, juice and the bread. This sandwich surprised the hell out of me.

I do feel like you get the most bang for your buck with their Philly Cheesesteak. This sandwich was just plain greasy and so damn delicious. I wish I asked for extra provolone cheese because I could not get enough of it. I also had them add all the peppers, onions and mushrooms and they were sautéed perfectly.

I did try their white Bianca pizza and added some basil pesto to it and this was also awesome. I plan to try all their pizzas at some point. They offer a buy one, get one Happy Hour special between 4pm-7pm for any of their 10" pizzas.

Also at first I was a bit upset that the two cannoli's were $5.50, but they are seriously the best cannoli's I've ever had. I wish they were a little cheaper but it was definitely worth it.

The service was super friendly, fast and warm. I loved the atmosphere, the menu, and the employees here seemed to have great training as they enjoyed talking about the menu. I was tempted to try a pasta dish (which changes daily, usually two selections) but instead opted for the Sicilian sub. While I still haven't tried the pasta, I feel confident that I made the right choice.

I ordered the sub on sesame bread and it arrived as this MASSIVE two portion (unless you're very ambitious) sandwich. I mean, this sub fed me twice- it was the only thing I needed to eat all day. I also tried the meatballs as a consolation prize for not ordering the pasta and they were tender and delicious- hey I said the sub was the only thing I NEEDED, but I never denied that I'm a glutton. The sauce that came with it was good enough to get me excited about pasta there in the future, and I ate every last spoonful. No regrets.

Happened to stop by this place completely by accident and are we glad we did! The food was absolutely delicious!! My husband and I shared a slice of Margherita pizza, a meatball sub and their prosciutto sandwich. The staff was very friendly and accommodating! If you're looking for some casual Italian food at a reasonable price, I highly suggest this place!

Melody is she is one of the employees you almost think  that she is the owner lol!! Very patient very knowledgeable  excellent customer service took the time out to assist me with my The selections of food!  I did not feel rushed at all ! the establishment is clean the bathrooms are clean and the food is well prepped and is very fresh The  sauces are authentic ! very Italian , kind of like a New York City setting ! I would recommend this to anyone and it is also conveniently located right off the freeway as well!

Why does the SW side of Vegas have all of the good stuff?! 
Plantone's is located in a plaza that already has a ton of amazing restaurants and it fits right in. The restaurant is cute and the service is great. Right away, someone will help you at the door with an explanation of sandwiches, pizzas, calzones, spaghettis, etc. The menu is extensive and the portions are HUGE. If you have a boyfriend that prioritizes quantity over quality this is the place to go. If you have a girlfriend that prioritizes quality over quantity, this is also the place to go. The food is amazing and the portions are huge. 
Calzone: The menu was confusing saying 1 meat, 1 vegetable, but we were told it's 3 meats? We were recommended the pepperoni and sausage, I would highly recommend it! We added green peppers and it was perfect. 
Angry sicilian: The sandwich was also what they recommended. With fresh mozarella and a huge portion of meat you can't go wrong. It was good, but I liked the calzone more. 
Happy hour has amazing prices and a really cute vibe. I'll for sure be recommending you guys!

This is our first time trying the place. We ordered to go. I ordered a parmesan chicken sandwich for myself and Parmesan pasta for the girlfriend. They had good customer service making small convo and all. Although we got the food fairly quickly, we drove home and noticed we didn't receive the correct order (it was a salad and chicken alfredo). We called about the incorrect order and drove back to return the food. They were apologetic and quick with replacing the meal and went on our way home. We checked our order again when we got home and 1 out of the 2 orders was correct. We got the parm pasta but not the parm sandwich. Instead we got a ham and onion sandwich with, I think, broccoli rabe sauce. I ate the sandwich bc I didn't feel like going back to return it. The food was pretty good even the order was wrong. I wish they would've compensated for the wrong order and driving back the first time but oh well. Lesson of the story, both sides need to check their food before handing it to the customer and before taking the food all the way home.

Trying this place today for the first time and were pleasantly surprised that they have Happy Hour on Saturday's! Not many places do in town. Pizza was fresh and yummy! The best part was the crust, you know that's very important. We tried the ricotta cheesecake too. I still can't believe we both had pizza, drinks and dessert for $22.  definitely recommend Plantone's.

I like their food but there hasn't been a time that they haven't made a mistake on my order and this is getting frustrating. I waste so much time with the corrections on a to-go order that I might as well have dined in. Have been here 4 times, all 4 times there's been an error. Missing toppings on pizza, COMPLETELY wrong order, extra food, missing food, no food at all for 26 minutes (I timed it). I dunno, maybe I'll give it more chance. Oh, also dont get their fried baloney sandwich - it comes completely black from overfrying. :(

Cashiers are too busy chit chatting when taking orders. Maybe this is why they come out wrong.

I stopped by for a late lunch last week and was pleasantly surprised.  Food was fabulous.  I had a "regular" size sandwich and it was huge.  It has Pesto Chicken grilled veggies and was full  all kinds of good and flavorful items.  I will definitely be back.  Soon!
AMAZING FOOD & awesome staff!! Definitely a do-over!!! It's like a famous place!!! We recommend this to EVERYONE!! SERIOUSLY!!!
Went there twice now- good food, super nice wait staff and servers, nice location, reasonable price.

I am so happy this Italian restaurant is gold!! It replaced the large Mac Shack location, and though I was initially bummed about its closure, I would take Plantone's Italian Market over it any day. Quality Italian sandwiches!

Because this place is new, I have yet to try other items on the menu. I got the Eggplant Parmesan Sandwich, my boyfriend ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo. Keep in mind that Fettuccine Alfredo isn't even an item listed on the menu, but ask and ye shall receive. They are very flexible on making common pasta's even if it's not their listed "Pasta of the Day" - you just need to ask. Brownie points for great customer service & accommodation!

Italian restaurants are always, always over-priced, so I was relieved to find this place REASONABLY priced. Granted, it primarily sells sandwiches and pizza, but don't underestimate the quality. All of their bread and noodles are made in-house, so you get the FRESHEST results.

My boyfriend said his Fettuccine was delicious (very fine dining like / balanced additions of garlic, parmesan, and butter) and my Eggplant Parmesan sandwich was to die for. The default bread they use for hot subs is so soft and fresh.

As for dining in? Very clean, spacious, complete with regular tables, as well as bar stools and large TV's. A great place to come in and catch sports.

Good for a quick and delicious Italian meal. A friend and I recently dined here and loved everything we ordered. 

When you enter there are large menu boards to the right listing all of the delicious menu items. They offer pizza (whole and by the slice), pastas, meat dishes, appetizers, sandwiches, and a few desserts. Order at the counter, get a number, and wait at the table for your food to arrive.

Pizza by the slice is more like half of a pizza with the large portion. Both types we tried were delicious, the Paulie's Pesto Chicken and Tony's Pepperoni. All of the ingredients tasted fresh and the pizzas had enough grease to feel indulgent without ruining the pizza. The pizza slices were inexpensive for the portion and quality.

Momma's Meat Lasagna was okay with the a meaty bolognese sauce on top, but it wasn't overly memorable. I loved the Antipasto appetizer that was loaded with meats, cheese, and other goodies. The presentation was nice too.

My wife had a salad which she liked & my son had pizza which he says was good. I ordered the pasta of the day and it wasn't bad. If your looking for pasta choices like Mac Shack this isn't the place as they only have one pasta dish a day.  My only real complaint was portion size. It literally was a kid size portion. Even my wife said where's the other half? The other thing which is minor is they don't wait to bring out everyone's food together. They brought out our food in 4 different trips over about 5 minutes which anyone with restaurant experience knows is a no no. I will try it again but will not order the pasta due to portion and price.

Nutella calzone is soooooo good! Not on the menu but worth waiting for it to be a special! Made with their pizza dough.... awesome! Also had BYO pizza that I refused to share! Thanks plantones for making my night! Can't wait to come back!

What a great place! The employees are awesome, it's great to be greeted right when you walk in with a smile & assistance! We got the rundown of what's on the menu, the specials and all that. I decided to go with spaghetti and meat sauce & my friend got fettuccine with bolognese sauce. The noodles are made fresh there and you can definitely taste the difference! It was very good. The pasta was served with 3 small pieces of fresh bread. We also got the Nutella dessert pizza with bananas and strawberries! So yummy! I will definitely be back to this restaurant. :)

I was excited to try this new restaurant as I am a high fan of supporting local businesses. After driving around the parking lot for 10 minutes to find a spot, I was impressed upon entering as the remodel on the space was extensive. The ordering was awkward as apparently there is a fridge under the register that they take the order at, and one of the staff was getting supplies out while the order taker stood awkwardly behind him. Instead of acknowledging me and apologizing for the situation, she avoided eye contact and didn't even say hello. When that moment had passed, she seemed very confused by my order which was pretty simple - the roast pork sandwich and a spinach salad with the dressing on the side - all to go. After repeating my order several times she asked me to move down to the cashier station. Again - another awkward situation as I stood there waiting for the cashier for several minutes. All staff who walked past avoided eye contact and no reason was given for the absence of the cashier. Several minutes later the cashier appeared and thankfully she apologized for the delay. The wait for the food wasn't too bad, and left the restaurant within 15 minutes of arriving. Upon returning to work I opened the bag and saw that not only had they put the dressing on the salad (after several requests for it to be on the side) but there was so much dressing the salad was inedible. The roast pork sandwich looked delicious, but the broccoli rabe was so tough that I had to take it off the sandwich and eat it separately. As excited as I was to try this place, I have doubts about returning with my family.

Our favorite neighborhood go to spot! The food tastes homemade and the service is always on par. The server, Roberto, is always attentive and greets us with a smile which makes us feel welcome. Our favorite pizza is the quattro formaggio. Don't miss the ricotta cheesecake! Love this place! Can't wait for it to warm up outside so we can sit out on the patio :-)

Found this place on yelp & the reviews influenced us to cancel our food plan & order for pick up from here. The food was good but not anything like the reviews had described. Also I received a call from them shortly after ordering online explaining that they did not have a few items we ordered. Not sure why those items are in the menu since they do not carry them but I digress...& btw I am Italian & from Chicago so this type of food needs to be impressive for me as I've eaten a lot of the best! But this place actually smelled like BO when I went to pick up our stuff & I wasn't crazy about their pizza style. Don't get me wrong it's not awful but unfortunately it didn't meet my high expectations

2nd visit to Plantone's today, pizza was fabulous.  Crust was perfect, and toppings were fresh and tasted great. Had a sub on my 1st visit, and the bread and meats were very good. Service here is incredible, you can tell that they really appreciate their customers.

Wanted to try the new place close to home. 
Ordered a calzone with mozzarella, ricotta and sausage. 
The crust was tough, the filling was very skimpy  to non existent. 
I will continue my loyalty to Rocco's.

Finally a place in Las Vegas to get authentic Italian food. Great pizza and sandwiches! The angry Sicilian and roast Italian pork top the list!!  Tiramisu and chocolate calzone for dessert. Yum! Very friendly and homey staff. Reminds me of home! Thank a million Tony. You too Jay n Marisa
Great little Italian restaurant the chicken Parma is no joke wow it was good and the pizza fries you better bring a appetite will come back great customer service to

Even though this spot is relatively new, I wouldn't hesitate to call it one of the city's finest. Everything is fresh and delicious as well as reasonably priced. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and some of the views from the outside patio are great. The service was excellent. Can't wait to make a return trip.

That pepperoni pizza! That sausage and peppers sub! There's more to try but those two are bomb! 
Stone oven pizza btw.

One of my regular go to neighborhood restaurants the angry Sicilian is is legit and lasagna is really good.  The Italian bread is soft and light perfect for a sandwich. Not everything is great on the menu but these two items have me coming back on a regular basis. Nice outdoor seating area as well.

Have visited twice now. I've had their daily pasta (unimpressed), chicken Parmesan pasta (3.5 stars), and calzone (5 stars). My only gripe is that it is a bit expensive in general, but it's a nice place and I'll be back.

This place is amazing!

I worked during their grand opening and found nothing wrong with their service, food or atmosphere!

Once you walk into the restaurant, it feels much larger than compared to what it was before (Mac Shack). The staff is very welcoming, but some are still learning (which is understandable).
When it came to ordering, the cashier made sure that you got the right size of whatever item you wanted.
Then, when it was delivered to the table later on, the staff made sure that you had everything you needed to enjoy your meal.

When I was there, I ordered the 10" Mama's Margherita Pizza and was so satisfied! The crunch was just right for the crust, it wasn't burnt or undercooked, and the homemade mozzarella was phenomenal!

Along with that, I got a side Caesar salad and a drink and it was all reasonably around $10!

To top things off, the owner of the restaurant--his name is Glenn, and he made sure I knew it was with two N's-- is the most endearing man. He's a local, UNLV alumni and probably the sweetest as can be.

If you need a good fix for pasta, pizza or subs, try this place out! I'm sure you won't regret it.

Sadly, just as overhyped and underperforming as the pasta place this replaced.  Prices are too high for the portion.  Husband got the Angry Sicilian sub which he said was greasy and bland.  The paper it was wrapped up in was soaked through with grease.  My meat lasagna was also mega greasy, so much so that it was hard to taste anything other than oil, and the pasta layers were mushy.  I might give this place another try to see if the pizza is any better, but I was very disappointed.

First time to dine here and I love it. Great customer service; they interact with customers withot annoying us! Their food were delicious, antipasto board OMG all I can say... Shrimp Alfredo cooked perfectly... The price were very reasonable.... Love the ambience :)

Sooo i ordered a sandwich, pasta and pizza but forgot to tell the teller I ordered a pizza so we left without it. Got food home realized pizza was left at store without paying so we left food on bed and went back to the store. Paid for said pizza and left. Lo and behold we get home, walk upstairs and our dog had clawed the container of pasta open all over the bed and the sandwich was completely eaten with lettuce all over the bed and floor. Calmly after sending our dog to "spot", we called back to reorder and the owner gifted us one of the meals. I could not be happier with the service. He didn't have to do that. I will def frequent this place again. Thanks for understanding.

OMWOW! Fresh fresh fresh! Mom and I loved the food. Top quality. She had soup of the day clam chowder and I a side salad. We shared a Philly cheesesteak. We are so satisfied. The food  is fresh n delicious.

Ordered the pasta of the day (meat sauce) and a white pizza (10in) around 8pm to go.  Service was friendly and quick.(Mariska and victor)..also had a glass of wine while I waited. 
Food was seasoned good and pizza was pretty tasty....decent size portion of pasta for the monet....first time visiting the place will be back again soon =)
good food with fresh ingredients... the personal pizza is good enough for 2. They also have a italian market sorta thing ... i can get ingredients to make tiramisu...
Most delicious pizza and philly sandwich ever! Very clean, friendliest service and a large variety of authentic Italian delicious food. And the price is perfect.

Visited after seeing on Yelp that a Roast Pork, Broccoli Rabe and Provolone sandwich was on the menu I'm giving 5 stars in anticipation of when a different bread supplier will be used, since the bread on my sandwich didn't stand up to the sandwich. Clean store, concerned employees. Oddly, there is a Jersey Mikes adjacent. That's like having a Taco Bell next to a real Mexican restaurant.

Unfortunately, I live up the street from this place...

5 Reasons for 5 Stars:
1. Authentic Italian food & atmosphere. 

2. Great patio with fire pit. 

3. Accommodated me being a vegan. I would recommend Pasta Primavera or Primavera Sub. 

4. Great place to watch a game.  

5. Owner (Glenn Plantone) seems to cares about his customers and their taste buds!

Traveled across town to try this place out.  My family and I ordered subs.  As another review mentioned, it is a bit confusing if you have not been there.  The ordering register is located on the opposite side of where the front door is.  There was a greeter that did tell you how it worked.  Did not really check out the "market" area except for a quick glance.  We ordered the meatball, philly, and sausage subs.  All were on perfectly toasted buns.  The meat in each were tasty and hot.  Sauce was ok.  Nothing special there.  The atmosphere is great.  They have seating in and outside.  Little pricey for my taste but would go back if I was in the area.

Decent pizza, yummy cheddar broccoli soup, great service! I wish the pizza here was a little crispier, but they have a great student deal for a personal pizza and soda for around $6. Definitely get a cannoli, it comes with two so you can share or chow down!

Great new Italian restaurant just opened up in this center. Freakin delicious sandwich, get the Angry Sicilian. Pizza was great, thin new York style.

Staff was super friendly and helpful, the atmosphere is very nice and the huge patio is going to be awesome for big groups, parties.

Definitely check it out. The personal size pizza cooks in 90 seconds! What?!

I grew up in an Italian family in Philly and NJ. It's not easy finding legit hoagies and Italian food in this part of the country. Plantone's is the best I've found in Las Vegas by far and would hold up anywhere. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Food is delicious. Place is clean, comfortable and has a good outdoor area too. I'll definitely be back. Bummed I don't live closer.

Not a good start for a local eatery in the southwest area. Ordered a large sandwich (supposed to be 10-11") to go, and came home to a very small sandwich (6-7") Big deal considering its a 15 dollar sub. I even asked the person making the sandwich if that was the correct size, he said yes. See the photo for proof. The photo says it all. For a great deli sandwich, ill go to Butcher Block down the street from now on.


EDIT: The Owners of the restaurant were kind enough to reach out and apologize for the situation. Invited me to come to the restaurant and have a do over. WIll update my review once i get a chance to do that. Promising that they cared enough to reach out though.

Customer service was okay, food was alright. They show the hockey games here! And they have a cute outdoor dining space. We ordered mozzarella sticks, fettuccine Alfredo, pesto chicken pizza and pepperoni with pineapples.

First time visiting our new locally owned Italian Deli, Plantone's! My daughter and I had a late lunch and we were so excited to try this new eatery! I take pride on supporting local businesses! We had the Angry Sicilian and the Goodfellas Sub. Both were so yummy! Fresh Italian bread made on site and they serve wine. The grocery store is nice and the service is INCREDIBLE!!  Everyone is so friendly and kind! Great customer service! Glenn, the owner and his staff are "salt of the earth" people. We will always return! Please support this great locally owned business!!!
Delicious comfortable setting great music & service!! Yes in my book!! This place is where the older Mac Shack was!! Great place !!! Everything fresh!

Went for the for the Grand Opening. They encouraged people to start camping out at 12:00am. It didn't happen. We got there at 8 A.M. with 4 people in line. We ended up 7th and 10th in line by 8:30 ish.

LET ME TELL YOU! People are hitting themselves for missing this. Great open atmosphere, awesome patio for when it gets warmer. The staff beyond amazing. The poor guy who had to stand outside and keep things organized amazing. Explained everything to the T, and kept calm. They even had people park at Vons's walk over and without a doubt he knew what spot you were in. By 10:45 it was at 100. 

At 11:00 when they opened it was spot on amazing. You walked in knowing what you wanted, as they handed out menus. It was a easy flow. They have been open a month or so, and the place still seems very clean and organized. Every employee knew what their task was.

Food: 5/5

With a mass opening like this I thought the few good 10 orders would be kinda a shock and have a few things wrong. Nope. So then I thought at least one person would have something wrong. Nope. The only problem was Togo or dinein. But if that's your issue. By all means you rocked.

Pizza Blanca: AMAZING! The cheeses and the Onion compliment it so well, but the bites of chicken set it off. The crust is great. Has some char-marks but not burnt. If you like it a little more krispy just ask, they will handle it. 

Pesto Chicken Pizza: Actually is very good. My partner loved it. I thought it was very good.

Chicken Parm Sandwich: So we shared food with a gentleman named John in line. Which was awesome. He gave us each a piece of his sandwich. I must say their red sauce is amazing. To die for. With the small piece of chicken (because i got the middle of the two cutlets, in a large sandwich) was cooked very well. Not to much coating at the end of the chicken as filler. Hands down was great. 

Glen the owner is very kind. Can talk to anyone! Staff is 5/5. I can't wait to see how this place grows! Congrats!

Tried this gem yesterday and thoroughly enjoyed it! My boyfriend and I split the Angry Sicilian sandwich and a medium size sausage pizza - more than enough food for the two of us.

The pizza was stellar! My mouth is watering again just thinking about it.  Sandwich was delicious as well made with quality fresh ingredients. And all for a reasonable price.  We will definitely be back!

The food here is great, don't bother on a Sunday though. I literally stood in front of 4 employees for 5 straight minutes and no one said a word. Not "hello", not "can I help you?", Just talked to each other until we left and went to Jersey Mike's. 

In case you were wondering we were the only customers in the place and it was 2 hours before they close.

Very good classic Italian food, I do wish they would offer more pasta dishes although I understand it is hard making all that pasta from scratch.

The staff was friendly and helpful and the manager took the time to go to each table to ask how the dishes were.

Overall I would definitely come back, next time trying some of their hot subs
This place is so delicious! We eat here often! The Margherita pizza and sausage/peppers sandwich are to die for! We will continue coming here!

My husband and I swung into this little Italian market not expecting much and were we ever greatly surprised. What a great experience  we had. The emploees are super sweet and the atmosphere was nice, clean and relaxing with italian music playing and cute outdoor patio seating. The food was unbelievably fresh and delicious with a beautiful presentation.  I had a spinach with roasted garlic calzone, it came to the table on a white plate & silver tray with baby  spinach leaves and fresh grated parmesan cheese on top.   Their mozzarella cheese is so creamy, buttery and delicious that you instantly know that it's made in house. My husband had a sausage & pepper sandwich that had fresh italian sausage and lots of peppers on a soft bun. This place is definitely 5 stars and we will be back  with friends.d

I came for their grand opening and was able to get a year's worth of pizza with a weekly customer punch card. Stoked.

Everything I've tried here so far has been outstanding. They use boar's head meat on their sandwiches so the ingredients are quality.

What I've tried:

Angry Sicilian sandwich: A loaded sandwich that was so good I forgot to take a picture. I guess it's their signature sub. I was surprised to hear it's only 10 inches as it does look a lot bigger when you get the large...seems to dwarf a Subway foot long.

Meatball sandwich: Ridiculously tasty meatballs formed to perfect size with outstanding sauce in their freshly baked bread. The meatballs have a hint of distinct seasoning that stands out from other meatballs I've had and it really works...will have to ask what it is if I run into the owner again.

Custom pizza: Soft, airy crust with a hint of garlic, a little light on the cheese and sauce put probably because I loaded up on the other ingredients. If you want to add "roasted vegetables" don't assume it's roasted peppers or a mix of other roasted veggies, it's actually just eggplant. I'm not an eggplant fan and especially not an eggplant on pizza fan so I'll give the roasted vegetables topping a miss next time, perhaps they should call it exactly what it is: eggplant. I also opted for a ricotta cheese topping to compliment the meatballs, pepperoni and sausage and it was the light and creamy ricotta similar to what they use over at Pizza Rock, suffice to say I'm a fan of that stuff.

You can tell immediately if you have a chance to meet the owner that he is extremely involved and passionate about the food they are putting out. They are also active in giving back to the community through various charities. 

I'll be looking forward to many future visits this year and further down the road.

Quite a bit of hit and miss at this small casual Italian spot in the SW. Nothing bad, but not much considered extraordinary....

With the exception of a surprisingly GREAT White Pie!

Pizza Bianca : White Sauce, Ground Sausage, Caramelized Onions, Fontina Cheese, Grated Parmesan & Extra Virgin Olive Oil. Very good white pie, love the sausage flavor and the white sauce leaning towards sweet. Excellent!! 

The rest I wouldn't order again. But the pie worthy of a second visit alone :)

Enjoy!

Had the Angry Sicilian. Let me tell you what...On Point! This is a Beast of a sandwich and i devoured the entire thing and washed it down with a nice cold Birra Moretti. I really enjoy a good ol' fashioned family owned Italian deli. Great Job guys!

This was my first time visiting Plantones. I was double charged for part of my order which the cashier willing fixed after I noticed it, but then when I got back to the office and opened my sandwich it was missing two of the major ingredients. Dang!! :(

Best Italian Sausage & Pepper Sub I've had in years. Maybe since Brooklyn. The pizza and pasta dishes looked fantastic. Clean plates on every table. This place is the real deal. Definitely coming back next time I'm in town.

I went to this place to try it out last week and I was pretty disappointed. There are a lot of kinks to work out in terms of logistics. I went there to place my order after work- (so like 6pm during the workweek) and it's not busy at all. I go to place my order and the cashier, a blonde girl, says "Hold on! I'm not ready yet!" The thing is, I hadn't said a word. I was 'holding on'...not the greatest first impression, but young people get stressed out easily. I just wait until she is ready. Finally, she calls me over and then as soon as I start to speak she tells me to hold on again so she can answer the phone. Meanwhile, there are like 25 employees all everywhere trying to create a fun environment but just trying too hard and making it super awkward. One guy asks me my name, I tell him and then he tells the rest of the staff and they keep saying my name every  chance they get thinking this is somehow a catchy marketing ploy? I'm not sure but it was obnoxious. So finally, girl is off the phone and I'm ready to order now. Then, the phone rings again- no apologies, nothing.  She just answers. I'm visibly pissed and she recognizes that so she placed the caller on hold this time so I could finally order. After about a 10 minute dance with her, I place my order. Sandwich and individual pizza. She tells me 30 mins. What?!? Jesus! I paid already so whatever- I decide to drive directly across the street to Von's to pick up some stuff. I haven't even parked... Less than 5 minutes had passed and some man calls and tells me my order is ready and to come pick it up. I ask him how that's possible? 5 mins ago, I was told 30 mins. He repeated my order to me. I confirmed and he said yup, ready. Weird but ok. Even better. So I go across the street again- (if you know this area, you know how impossible this can be during this time of day) and I finally make it and go to pick up my order. I get there and, of course, my order was not ready. They did however, say my name at least 20 more times to add to this lovely experience. I finally got my food. It was correct and edible which is why they get two stars. Mediocre quality at best. Two stars is generous, trust me. Soggy pizza and bland sandwich. 

Suggestion: Service matters as much, if not more than the product. Please keep your eyes on the face of your business. (Ashley, I think was her name) Also, invest in some salt and pepper and make sure all moving parts are communicating with each other so you have a decent shot at a first impression. Finally, quality control. Pizza was super soggy because it was not timed to be ready when the sandwich was. 

Best of luck to you folks- I love supporting mom and pop shops- hopefully this experience was the exception and not the rule.
Their food is very good with nice portions. Entire staff is very friendly and accomadating. Only negative is only one pasta dish on the menu. They need to improve their pasta menu.

First off their customer service is so good here. They make you feel like a guest in their home. They helped me pick out my slice of chicken tomato pesto pizza. And it is so good the crust is tasty and crispy without being  burnt. I can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

I was excited to finally get to see this place for myself. I love Italian delis and always feel a bit nostalgic when I find one. Reminds me of my favorite vacation to Italy. Anyways the place is clean and well decorated. Its more a deli than a market, which is fine because there food is amazing! I ordered the Angry Italian. It was SO good. I don't remember exactly what my gf ordered, But she isn't a sandwich fan anyway. She probably ordered a salad. I've been planning to come back here to eat everyday now, but never do make it. I want to try that delicious looking antipasto platter!!

Twice visited in the past and thrice utilized for catering it was alongside three adults and a child that dinner service was finally sat down to at Plantone's Italian Market on Friday, past experience yielding a superior Pizza than those ordered for Take-Out but the rest of a five-item order again showing inconsistency, though nothing was particularly "bad."

Now approaching 18-months of service and busy on this particular evening, a heavier prominence on Social Media and updated online Menus perhaps finally spreading the word of Glenn Plantone's tribute to Uncle Tony, it was just prior to 5pm that guests grabbed a high-top before placing an order, the lack of Happy Hour specials admittedly surprising in the setting of a 5/23/18 Instagram post though overall cost remains affordable.

Sticking to counter-style ordering that only serves to confuse first-timers, some thirty feet separating menus from the register, it was shortly after paying the tab that a number and cups for self-service Beverages were provided, items rolling out one-by-one with an entrée of Chicken Parm arriving first, the pounded Breast juicy and light in oil though the Pasta was still too watery which led to Sauce already under-spiced being thinned out and mostly left to waste.

Next receiving six fried Ravioli, the texture fine but neither Cheese Filling nor Sauce doing much to compel anyone to finish one remaining, it was here that a "well done" Pizza Bianca substituting Sausage for Chicken was delivered, the crust still a far cry from Sin City's best due to a lack of leavening but toppings all mingling well with sautéed Onions playing well off crumbled Pork and Fontina.

Rounding out savories with previously "secret menu" Pizza Fries, the Steak-cut Spuds flaccid even in areas not saturated with Sauce or added Ricotta, it was with far less attention to visuals than the one pictured online that a Nutella Calzone was finally sliced, the cost of $10.95 a far for "Calzone of Day BYO" as listed on the receipt not noticed till later inexplicably higher than the Nutella Pizza regardless of the suggested "1/2 off Happy Hour" which was nowhere to be found.

TWO STARS: Apparently achieving at least some notoriety as of late, though the odd order of delivery with Dessert preceding Fries makes one wonder if the kitchen can keep up with even a 33% filled dining room, Plantone's Italian Market simply does not have what it takes to compete with other locals such as Naked City or Metro let alone the likes of Esther's Kitchen where Appetizers such as stuffed Zucchini Blossoms only cost a few bucks more than the fried Ravioli and handmade Pasta is the same price as Chicken Parm atop watery boxed Noodles.

After reading a couple of good reviews on the angry Sicilian sub, I decided to try it. Initially it look good but had no flavor, so i asked for some salt and pepper. I then realized 2 of the ingredients list on the menu were missing from my sandwich. I was missing roasted red peppers and oregano. I'm confused how they missed a few ingredients on one of their signature sandwiches not sure if I'll be back.

This place is the best! Fresh made mozzarella, good ingredients, awesome pizza. Their pizza is ridiculous, not too thin, but not thick crust - great toppings. The Angry Sicilian sandwich is one of the best takes on a classic Italian sandwiches I've had in Las Vegas. So happy to have this place opening finally!
Great food, great service and ambience. Staff is very friendly and the food is good. The pesto chicken pizza is delicious!
Great food, great service and the owner Glenn is a great guy!  The pastas, pizzas, salads and desserts are all on point!  Highly recommend!

This is a new place located in the Southwest area of Las Vegas. The atmosphere was very welcoming and even had the chance to meet the owner. I enjoyed the four things I had to try. If I could recommend anything I would say to order the sandwiches. I think their pizza is alright but I ordered two sandwiches and both were better than the pizza. Overall, I would suggest the fried bologna or the chicken Parmesan as the two winners! The mustard on the friend bologna is the bomb!

I've had the eggplant parmesan sub and the roasted vegetariano sub; both are good, though I wish they just had eggplant parmesan as a dish.  Since there are already pizza and sub places on the same block I'd like if they had more dinnertime options.

Oh Plantone's! You've stolen my heart the moment I walked in!

I like to browse Yelp from time to time and found out about Plantone's! It's brand spanking new and I told my boyfriend that we have got to try it! So one day, we stopped in for lunch. We got greeted the moment we walked in and if you've never been there before, they give you a small briefing about the establishment, which is fantastic! Except ... I couldn't keep my attention on their briefing because my curiosity got the best of me and my eyes started to wander...
