Plantone's has a very casual atmosphere to their establishment. One side is the kitchen, reminding me of a cafeteria-esq area where you can see them cooking. At the end of it, you order with the cashier and she gives you a number. Then you pick a seat on the other side and wait -- either for your food or your to go order. They also have stuff for you to buy if you so desire. A lot of it are imported, I believe -- they have pasta, sauces, olive oil, etc. 

So far we've tried three of their items: the angry sicilian, plantone's parma, and their pasta of the day, which was a linguine with a bolognese sauce.  The angry sicilian had a TON of meat on it with their house made mozzarella, roasted peppers, olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The plantone's parma focused on their imported prosciutto with mozzarella and arugula, which is a fairly simple sandwich. Their sandwiches are available in either a 6 inch sub or a 10 inch sub and you are able to choose what type of bread you would like with it. 

From our experience, the 6 inch sub comes with a pickle and peppers while the 10 inch does not. If you would like your sub to be cut in half, you would have to ask because it's not an auto thing for them. 

The angry sicilian is our FAVORITE. It's absolutely delicious and everything just meshes together so very well. Their mozzarella is definitely a winner. I would definitely recommend this particular sandwich if you didn't know what to try first. The plantone's parma is also delicious but it seems a little lacking compared to the angry sicilian. While I understand that imported prosciutto is pricey, I can't help but to notice that the angry sicilian and plantone's parma is the same price yet the angry sicilian is so much more filling than the plantone's parma.

The pastas that they have changes daily, thus the term "pasta of the day" and the best part? They are also house made and you can definitely tell because the texture of their pasta is different and thinner than what you can get in a box. Their pastas are good and simple -- nothing too complicated. So if you're looking for something complicated, then you probably shouldn't try it.

Aside from sandwiches and pastas, they also have pizzas. I have yet to be able to try them but I will soon enough!  

TRY THIS PLACE. OK. THANKS.

Came here for dinner last night and had a great experience! Had the buy 1 get 1 free large pizza. Tried the Tony Pepperoni and Bianco Pizzas. Very good! There was a gentleman by the name of Roberto who was amazing to say the least. From the time we walked in, during our dining and until we left - his customer service was above and beyond. Haven't tried anything else and their menu isnt huge however do to this experience I will definitely come back. Thank you!

It was my daughter's birthday today, and she wanted Italian for dinner.  I heard about Plantone's from a co-worker, so our family decided to try it out since it is close to home.  The place is small and quaint, but fortunately, it wasn't crowded.  We ordered two different pizzas, a calzone, a cheesesteak, an antipasto plate, and a pasta.  The food came out pretty quickly, and everything was fresh and delicious!  The employees were very friendly. We will definitely be back and bring our family and friends!!!

Customer service on point food not so much. I was hoping this place would be great after the horrible Mac shake. I ordered the pasta of the day special order Alfredo. The sauce is so salty I could barely eat it, the only reason I did was because I had not eaten all day and did this as a to go order. Caprese salad just ok not much balsamic on it. I will give it another try because it's close by home. Also the price is expensive for what little portions they give.

Wonderful food, great atmosphere. This place definitely didn't disappoint. Large portions and fresh ingredients, everything tasted authentic!! Had their meatball sub and my fiancé had a chicken pesto calzone that he kinda built himself. Both were very good. We will be back!

This place is a really great addition to the food options in the SW. Their cold sandwiches are great, happy hour is cool and the pizza rivals Grimaldi's at a fraction of the cost. The environment is also really chill. Perfect little date night spot. I haven't had the pastas yet but they look awesome so that's next.

First time trying Plantone's this afternoon and it was excellent. The atmosphere was cozy and quaint, they also have a patio with a fire pit. The pizza was reasonably priced and absolutely delicious. We will definitely be back!

We are  still looking for an amazing Italian place with great lasagna.  I phone ordered the Margarita 10" individual pizza, the green salad with no onion, the lasagna, and garlic bread with some alfredo sauce on the side.  My husband gets home with the food and he says there wasn't a soul in the restaurant but they told him that the food wasn't ready because they had a rush. There was no crumbled feta on the green salad (I was really looking forward to that because I love Feta) but there were onions. The pizza didn't look like the pictures i saw online,  it was a regular cheese pizza with a few bits of basil, and the lasagna was no bigger than the palm of my hand (but it cost almost $13), there was no thickness and no toasted cheese on top, it seemed microwaved.  The garlic bread had zero garlic flavor and the alfredo sauce was bland. The food was edible but there was nothing special about it. I was really hoping that this would be our new spot but like I said, disappointing.

Simply the best spot in Las Vegas when u want Italian food and market  mamas lasagna  is must  every pizza is perfect   Very friendly staff with Glenn the owner and melody the host The prices are perfect too You must go to if you live In Vegas
We got the lasagna and the meatball sub. Wow. Soooooo delicious!!!!! Both were equally delicious ! We will be coming back again soon for sure! :)
Love the Angry Italian sub! Delicioso! The people are very friendly. Just a cool place to have a bite to eat!

I'm reviewing the roast pork sandwich. Great bread, tasty and moist pork, sharp provalone and broccoli rabe make for a delicious combo. I only wish I had ordered the 10 inch rather than the 6 inch. Definitely would get that again and wanna try the numerous other sandwiches available.

There is definitely something to be said for an establishment that cares enough to go the extra mile to make sure the customer is happy.  Love the food here, tried almost everything on the menu at this point.  You won't be disappointed if you try it.  Let me tell you, we want to keep this place busy, we WANT it to stay open and available to us for AWESOME food at a very reasonable price!

We were excited to try Plantones after checking them out on Instagram. The restaurant is located on the corner of a busy strip mall. Parking was pretty tricky... I had to drive around for a while to find a spot. 

Once inside, I was greeted immediately. I liked the open kitchen - it was nice seeing how everything was prepared. The happy hour specials were great, so we ordered some drinks and food. Here's the rundown.. 

Margherita pizza - Delicious dough. Very flavorful, good chew. Unfortunately, the pizza had way too much cheese. The pizza was heavy and soggy. Kinda disappointing. 

Meatballs - light and fluffy. Good sauce. Would definitely order again. 

Angry sicilian sub - good, but dry. Missing something to tie it all together. 

Mozz sticks - big and crispy. We'd definitely order again.

The outdoor area is really nice and we would definitely give this place another shot.

The lasagna was quite tasty.   They were out of minestrone soup at 1 pm on a Sunday, which was a big disappointment to the wife.   I was surprised that they did not serve bread with the entree Lasagna.   Portions were large.  Good music mix and nice seating in the dining room.  Nice outdoor dining area.  Parking will be a problem here.

Love the Italian fare at this cute little Italian deli. My husband and I dropped in for lunch and he had the chicken parmesan and I had the lasagna special. Both orders included bread and we got a lovely little Caesar Salad for just a $1.50 more. We sat outside in this beautiful weather on their patio. Additionally, the girl with short blonde hair was so welcoming and attentive. We will absolutely return and highly recommend for those craving delicious Italian eats.

Was not as expected. Thought it would be more like a real Italian market, not so much. Food was very good though. Huge sandwiches (needed it cut into quarters) a little confusing when you first enter about where you should go. A bit pricey.
Delicious. Good service, fresh meats, tasty cheeses and delicious fresh bread. We had subs and they were probably the best we have had in Vegas. Everyone was super nice and service was great.

I really hope this place makes it because I love the concept.

Good food. Alcohol Served. Casual Atmosphere. No Wait Service.

We came on a Wednesday and got the 50% off bottle of wine. Great deal.

My girlfriend had a Margarita pizza that was excellent while I had the chicken parm with fettuccine. Honestly, my chicken was a pretty tough piece of meat...but everything else was good and I'm sure if I got it again it'd be better.

The food, at least my item, a veggie hoagie, was pretty good. I'd get it again. And service was friendly. I am giving them only three stars for two reasons: first, the item ended up being $2 more than what they list it as on the menu, for a reason I can not discern. Second, they didn't seem to have regular water in the dispenser, just carbonated water (yuck) along with various unhealthy drinks.

Love this place. My daughter and I have eaten here several times since they opened. The food is awesome , the service is great and the prices are reasonable.  Love the chicken parm sandwich and the pizza is so good.
Went here with friends today and loved it! So nice to have a great casual pizza, pasta and sub place so close to the house. The staff was very friendly and the service was great.

I have been looking forward to going here for some time. 

Now I must foreshadow the fact that I placed my to go order about an hour before closing on a Sunday so my review has a grading curve til next time. 

We ordered 2 pizzas, 2 sandwiches and a salad. 

Pizzas ... The chicken pesto was so heavy and not baked long enough so it was slimy and a challenge to eat even with knife and fork.  But the flavors were spot on delicious. 

The pepperoni pizza again the sauce and toppings were too heavy and the dough only seemed par baked.  But delicious none the less. 

The angry Sicilian ... That's the four star earning sandwich.  They could run their business off the sales of that sandwich alone. 

Chicken parmigiana sandwich was also good.  Their red sauce (both pizza and sandwich) are so good -- the chicken had a good breading and was weird chicken free ... But it was kinda on the over cooked side. 

The place is super cute, people seem very friendly and I am hoping to be able to eat in next time. 

Support your local, small businesses!

Awesome place, really great food and even better service. Food was fresh, everything is made in house. 
Tried the eggplant, the meatballs and the chicken cutlet all fresh and so delicious.
Also the split pea soup was amazing definitely not from any can. 
If you want a fresh taste of italy this is your spot.

il migliore! If you hate fresh, home-made mozzarella or fragrant, juicy meat...then don't order the Angry Sicilian. It is so delicious you'll start humming the theme song to the Godfather...because they are killin' it! Eat this at your own risk. Once you do, you'll just keep going back until you're as fat as I am. This is not a threat, it's a promise.

My daughter and I walked into this empty establishment for the first time at around 1:00 in the afternoon on a friday. As we entered, I noticed what appeared  to be 2 cooks in the back, and a young lady cleaning up the restaurant. We stood there aimlessly for atleast 3 minutes trying to figure out if we were supposed to seat ourselves or wait for a hostess. Nobody took the time to greet us, or give us direction. I decide to go to the counter and order. The cashier was extremely rude and abrupt, despite me tipping for what was essentially a self service restaurant. The food came out fairly quickly and was actually pretty good. Unfortunately , I couldn't enjoy it because the same rude, young lady decided to sweep right underneath our table while we were eating. She never asked how the food was or if we needed anything.  

The last straw was watching how pleasant she was to the couple that came in while we were hastily trying to finish our food and get out of there.  She was all smiles with a wonderful disposition. I NEVER assume that someone's attitude towards me is dictated by the color of my skin. But in this circumstance, I dont believe there is any other explanation. Needless to say, we wont be back.

This place is amazing. The prices are so affordable, yet the food is of the highest quality. I can tell everything has been freshly made and is literally the best pizza I have had in Vegas. The service is perfect. I am so happy I found it, my boyfriend is new to Las Vegas and is always saying the food here isn't great, but this place had him smiling so much. 5 starts, I can't believe the combo of price and quality.

I was pleasantly surprised by the updates to both the dining area and outside patio from the previous restaurant. The lasagna was amazing, pizza was good as well.  We had the Nutella cheesecake, it was okay, I wouldn't get it again but will be back.

Disappointed. The LVRJ wrote a column stating a real italian deli. Nope. Sandwiches overpriced, they were out of a lot of ingredients for the sub nor did they have any multi grain bread. Bread is far from NY style, not crispy at all. I really wanted this locally owned place to be better but I would walk three doors north for the Jersey Mikes chain for a sandwich. I did not have a hot menu item so maybe I ordered wrong thing.

If you are looking for quality, fresh ingredients this is the place to go! You can taste the difference and can tell everything is homemade! I am so happy to have two quality selections in the same plaza! The interior is great, staff was friendly and welcoming. Can't wait to try new menu items!
Great new spot to eat! Awesome staff that is courteous and the Italian food is delicious. Make sure you get a Cannoli too!
Ordered lunch pizza $9.95 and a soda the bill came to $15.00... and no receipt...! Mmm...Pizza was good....center a bit soggy.
Good pasta and pizza, and the sandwiches are huge and delicious. Need to visit a few times to enjoy all they have to offer.

Ordered a Veggie Pizza with pepperoni. Very simple and fresh ingredients! Nothing better than a pizza that tastes like Italy rather than a Americanized Pizza Hut pizza! :) New favorite place, I'm eager to try more on the menu!
Great food so far. We've had the pizza (super thin the way we like), calzone and steak sandwich. Sauce is really good. My husband said it's the best steak sandwich he's had in Vegas so far.
